sources.full: Finding your Path in the Krosmoz

entries.name: Unaligned Deities
entries: The gods in the World of Twelve are fickle and ever-changing. Be it due to their grand plans, capricious personality or reincarnating nature, most gods can fit any alignment. As long as mortals do not disrespect them or interfere with their plans, they do not have any regard for their faithfuls' alignment.
If any spell or effect requires you to choose an alignment your unaligned deity has, you instead choose from your own alignment.

trait.name: Osamodas
entries: A creature with this trait is a member of the {@ancestry Osamodas|FPKrosmoz|Osamodas's Whip}. {@ancestry Osamodas|FPKrosmoz} craft and use these weapons.

trait.name: Pandawa
entries: A creature with this trait is a member of the {@ancestry Pandawa|FPKrosmoz|Pandawa's Pint}. {@ancestry Pandawa|FPKrosmoz} craft and use these weapons.

trait.name: Ecaflip
entries: A creature with this trait is a member of the {@ancestry Ecaflip|FPKrosmoz|Ecaflip's Coin}. {@ancestry Ecaflip|FPKrosmoz} craft and use these weapons.

trait.name: Sadida
entries: A creature with this trait is a member of the {@ancestry Sadida|FPKrosmoz|Sadida's Shoe}. {@ancestry Sadida|FPKrosmoz} craft and use these weapons.

trait.name: Feca
entries: A creature with this trait is a member of the {@ancestry Feca|FPKrosmoz|Feca's Shield}. {@ancestry Feca|FPKrosmoz} craft and use these weapons.

trait.name: Enutrof
entries: A creature with this trait is a member of the {@ancestry Enutrof|FPKrosmoz|Enutrof's Fingers}. {@ancestry Enutrof|FPKrosmoz} craft and use these weapons.

trait.name: Xelor
entries: A creature with this trait is a member of the {@ancestry Xelor|FPKrosmoz|Xelor's Sandglass}. {@ancestry Xelor|FPKrosmoz} craft and use these weapons.

trait.name: Sram
entries: A creature with this trait is a member of the {@ancestry Sram|FPKrosmoz|Sram's Shadow}. {@ancestry Sram|FPKrosmoz} craft and use these weapons.

trait.name: Eniripsa
entries: A creature with this trait is a member of the {@ancestry Eniripsa|FPKrosmoz|Eniripsa's Hands}. {@ancestry Eniripsa|FPKrosmoz} craft and use these weapons.

trait.name: Fillable
entries: This weapon can be filled with liquid, such as a potion or elixir, up to a listed amount of Bulk. You can use one {@action Interact} action to drink the liquid from your weapon. Only one kind of liquid consumable can be stored in a weapon at a time.

trait.name: Bulldozing
entries: This weapon treats any object it hits as if it had one less Hardness than usual.

trait.name: Meticulous
entries: This weapon is ideal to attack an enemy's weak points. On a critical hit, the weapon adds a precision damage die of the listed size. Roll this after doubling the weapon's damage. This increases to two dice if the weapon has a {@item greater striking} rune and three dice if the weapon has a {@item major striking} rune. For instance, a {@item rapier} with a {@item greater striking} rune deals {@damage 2d8} extra precision damage on a critical hit. An ability that changes the size of the weapon's normal damage dice doesn't change the size of its meticulous die.

trait.name: Sacrier
entries: A creature with this trait is a member of the {@ancestry Sacrier|FPKrosmoz|Sacrier's Blood}. {@ancestry Sacrier|FPKrosmoz} craft and use these weapons.

trait.name: Ragged
entries: This weapon's edge is uneven with the specific purpose of drawing more blood. When you hit a creature, this weapon deals 1 additional alignment damage per weapon damage die.

trait.name: Cra
entries: A creature with this trait is a member of the {@ancestry Cra|FPKrosmoz|Cra's Range}. {@ancestry Cra|FPKrosmoz} craft and use these weapons.

trait.name: Beacon
entries: A special Cra mechanism activated by attacking it, usually with ranged weaponry. Bombs with this trait are thrown at terrain instead of creatures and don't deal damage until activated with a {@action Strike} targeting the beacon bomb or by otherwise damaging it. If the beacon is thrown but not activated, you can recover it as an {@action Interact} action.

trait.name: Iop
entries: A creature with this trait is a member of the {@ancestry Iop|FPKrosmoz|Iop's Heart}. {@ancestry Iop|FPKrosmoz} craft and use these weapons.

trait.name: Compulsion
entries: This weapon can channel your deity's favour. When you hit a creature of opposite alignment to you, this weapon deals 1 additional alignment damage per weapon damage die as appropriate for your alignment (for example, if you are good, you deal good damage, and if you are evil, you deal evil damage). If multiple alignments are applicable, you choose one of them.

ancestry.name: Feca
info: Fecas are excellent protectors. In fact, they pride themselves on being brilliant guards to whom even the wisest adventurers entrust their most precious items with complete confidence. Their reputation is firmly established in this field, even though they're usually not looking for honour or glory and would rather stay in the shadows.

Honest, loyal and upright, Fecas only have one defect: they can't stand being made to look like fools. Never compare a Feca disciple to a walking locker or safe, as you might just be asking for a staff blow in your face or across your bum cheeks, which would be a lot more painful and would make you look silly in front of everyone.

We've already noted that Fecas like discretion - it's pretty obvious, for Feca's sake! When bearded wise men entrust you with precious items to protect, you don't go shouting it from the rooftops of Amakna. It's also in Fecas' nature to be good shepherds, and, by extension, good priests and spiritual guides. They either bring the lost sheep back to the right path or lead them to the slaughterhouse. Fecas are appreciated within groups because of their protective powers but also because they master the staff like no one else.

items: Take comfort in the safety of others.
Find peace in the quietude of a library.
Be a natural leader.
Greatly rely on your defensive skills and magic.
Underestimate your offensive capabilities.
Find you overprotective.

info.name: Physical Description
entries: Followers of Feca are about as tall as other average humans of similar physique. Both their eye and hair colours can range from light blue to dark brown. Their hairstyles are varied too, often being either long and tied in ponytails or braids, or short and spiky. They also fashion glasses.

Fecas age at a similar rate to normal humans. Most Fecas can live to be up to 80 years of age, but the more powerful Fecas could live for nearly two centuries. Fecas weigh the same as normal humans of similar physique. Fecas like to wear simple and plain clothing, sometimes adding some light pieces of armor on top of it. Their clothes are often coloured yellow, orange, blue, and white.

info.name: Society
entries: Societies in the World of Twelve are highly multicultural, and in them Fecas often take on the jobs that involve caretaking or leading. All Fecas may praise their god to different degrees, but their religion does not necessarily play an important role in the society they live in. Shepherding is the traditional job of a Feca in the times of Dofus, but many also start their own adventuring guilds, or become researchers and alchemists.

info.name: Alignment and Religion
entries: Many Fecas tend to be good by nature, aiming to protect others, but they are not necessarily a majority. Some Fecas may search to keep people safe by force and become Evil-aligned tyrants, for instance. There is no real tendency towards Lawful or Chaotic, some aiming to to ensure safety by the ways of laws, others believing that the law is inherently oppressive, and many others simply uncaring of these notions.

info.name: Names
entries: Feca names are simple and homely.

entries.name: Sample Names
entries: Arty, Crail, Allisteria, Fallanster, Otomai, Igor Ant, Lukryh, Ereziah Melkewel, Bump

languages: {@language Common}

Additional languages equal to 1 + your Intelligence modifier (if it's positive). Choose from the list of common languages and any other languages to which you have access (such as the languages prevalent in your region).

heritage.name: Sentinel Feca
entries: You have been trained with a shield since a very tender age, as if it was part of you. You are trained in all shields, and you gain the {@feat Shield Block} feat.

heritage.name: Researcher Feca
entries: You are more fond of more scientific and magical ways to help your fellows. You become trained in {@skill Crafting} (or another skill if you were already trained in {@skill Crafting}) and gain the {@feat Alchemical Crafting} skill feat.

ancestry.name: Enutrof
info: A long time ago, Enutrofs set up a sign language based only on movements and figures they traced with their fingers. Their reason for creating such a language remains unknown; however, some say that Enutrofs can communicate without any of the creatures wandering about the abyss realising it. Others believe that Enutrofs code their treasures by combining geometrical figures drawn with their fingers. Others prefer to think that it's a ritual way of shielding the nose from the after-effects of the sickening explosions of underground gases (the famous firedamp farts which left many adventurers unconscious). Whatever the truth is, it was this habit that gave the Enutrof religion its name.

Enutrofs are interested in any goods, items and creatures that they can turn into kamas. Besides that, the first thing an Enutrof does when he meets another adventurer is to get the measure of him with a single look. In the eyes of an Enutrof, an adventurer is a rich source of goods, often bedecked in items. Enutrofs also talk a lot: often all sorts of nonsense about this and that, but also about things they're interested in like the rate of Gobball wool in Astrub, or if it's possible to find Treechnid Amber at a good price near Bonta, those sorts of things... If adventurers listen carefully, they may well be able to get their hands on knick-knacks and charms... for a small fee, of course.

items: Like to travel near and far in search of new experiences, likely collecting treasure along the way.
Always be on the lookout for the best deals.
Give more importance to material possessions over anything else.
Assume you have a great collection of riches.
Think that you are greedy and stingy.
See you as an old frail person.

info.name: Physical Description
entries: Followers of Enutrof are about as tall as other average humans, if not slightly shorter due to their arched back. Their eyes are often wrinkly and dark in colour, whereas their hair colour is light and graying. Enutrofs like to dress their hair in a variety of ways, often buns or ponytails, and those who can tend to grow their beards, maybe in opposition to their growing baldness.

Enutrofs age at a faster rate than normal humans, but live longer. Most Enutrofs can live to be up to 120 years of age, but the more powerful Enutrofs could live for nearly three centuries. Enutrofs weigh the same as normal humans of similar physiques, and are tougher than their frail appearance may suggest. Enutrofs wear baggy and comfortable clothing, often bought second-hand to save money, but sometimes decorated in gold. They usually bring a big bag with them to keep their favorite trinkets close or put in any new treasure they may find.

info.name: Society
entries: Societies in the World of Twelve are highly multicultural, and in them Enutrofs often take on the jobs that involve big amounts of kamas. All Enutrof may praise their god to different degrees, but their religion does not necessarily play an important role in the society they live in. The more peaceful Enutrofs will often have jobs at a bank or as merchants, whereas more daring ones will often become treasure seekers or headhunters.

info.name: Alignment and Religion
entries: Many Enutrofs tend to be neutral by nature, driven primarily by money, but they are not necessarily a majority. Some Enutrofs of the Lawful alignment may find ways to obtain riches through legal means, whereas other more Chaotic enutrofs may prefer more sneaky ways. As for the good and evil alignments, it is not uncommon for Enutrofs to put money before morals, but most prefer less vile ways.

info.name: Names
entries: Enutrofs have very varied names, and often put emphasis on their family names.

entries.name: Sample Names
entries: Terra Cogita, Terra Pinh, Babblera Nhin, Qwizitor Nhin, Honey Bagg, Sumens, Ruel Stroud, Moumoune Stroud, Arpagone

languages: {@language Common}

Additional languages equal to 1 + your Intelligence modifier (if it's positive). Choose from the list of common languages and any other languages to which you have access (such as the languages prevalent in your region).

features.name: Low-Light Vision
entries: You can see in dim light as though it were bright light, so you ignore the {@condition concealed} condition due to dim light.

heritage.name: Peddler Enutrof
entries: You aren't easily tricked and can recognize a bad deal when you see it. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your {@skill Perception} DC against attempts to {@action Lie} to you and your {@skill Perception} checks to {@action Sense Motive}.

heritage.name: Spelunker Enutrof
entries: Navigating mountains and other rocky terrain is second nature to you. You can ignore non-magical difficult terrain caused by rubble and uneven ground made of stone and earth.

ancestry.name: Iop
languages: {@language Common}

Additional languages equal to 1 + your Intelligence modifier (if it's positive). Choose from the list of common languages and any other languages to which you have access (such as the languages prevalent in your region).
info: One thing's for sure: you can't change a Iop! Once you appreciate this and are fully aware of it, you will get along with them much better. To be more efficient and gain time, some Iops reduce their vocabulary to about twenty words, which is enough for their daily needs: eat, drink, sleep, and fight. Eat again, drink again, sleep again and fight again... eat some more, drink some more and fight some more. They do know how to use their weapons, though, and that's enough to keep them happy. To give them some credit, they have a great range of insults that they tend to use when fighting: scabby Gobbly, Larva liver, Bloplicker, Trool droppings and so on. And all in all, Iops simply love their lives!

Their impetuous moods make Iops extreme warriors, capable of the worst as well as the best. Some Iops, such as the knight Rish Claymore, are famous for their strength and bravery. Others delight in violence and barbarity and have written their names in bloody letters on the wall of the World's history: Eratz the Protester might be the best example.

items: Eagerly meet any chance to prove your strength in a physical contest.
View dying in glorious combat as preferable to a mundane death from old age or illness.
Fight tooth and nail—sometimes literally—to protect yourself and your friends from danger.
Assume you can't—or won't—read.
See you as violent or lacking in discipline.
Recognize your incredible endurance and dedication.

info.name: Physical Description
entries: Followers of Iop tend to be tall and well-built. Even if an Iop seems lanky, they are likely to pack a punch! Their pupils tend to be of a very light colour, sometimes even as far as seeming to have entirely white eyes, and their face distinctly lacks a nose. Their hair is often long and spiky, and of a bright orange colour. Most Iops stand as tall as 6 feet from their feet to the top of their heads. An Iop's hair adds some extra height, with most hairstyles growing vertically as tall as one foot. Not all Iop hairstyles grow as vertically, however, and some Iops instead have hair that flops down behind their head.

Iops age at a similar rate to normal humans. Most Iops can live to be up to 80 years of age, but the more powerful Iops could live for nearly two centuries. Iops weigh the same as normal humans of similar well-built physiques. Iops typically wear long tunics, though they are comfortable in any clothing they can easily fight in. Crosses are also often depicted on their clothing.

info.name: Society
entries: Societies in the World of Twelve are highly multicultural, and in them Iops often take on the jobs that require more brawn than brain. All Iops may praise their god to different degrees, but their religion does not necessarily play an important role in the society they live in. Most of them will show a great deal of respect towards any great warrior, and notably towards high officials in the Temple of Iop.

info.name: Alignment and Religion
entries: In War there will always be good and evil, and it is the same amongst the followers of Iop. Their moral compass tends to be as simple as they are themselves, some evil-leaning Iops fighting for power and some good-leaning Iops fighting to protect, some chaotic-leaning Iops fighting for the thrill of it and some lawful-leaning Iops fighting to uphold the rules.

info.name: Names
entries: Most Iops have simple, short and easy to pronounce names. There are many cases nonetheless of Iops being named in a knightly manner or after weaponry.

entries.name: Sample Names
entries: Vald, Solar, Peggy, Rish Claymore, Goultard, Percival, Beldivere

heritage.name: Vitalized Iop
entries: Some Iops have trained to take more hits, in order to hit more. You gain 10 Hit Points from your ancestry instead of 8 and gain a +1 circumstance bonus to {@skill Athletics} checks to {@action Shove} or {@action Trip} foes.

heritage.name: Battleborn Iop
entries: Some Iops were born with a silver sword on their hand. You're trained in all simple and martial weapons. You also gain the {@feat Iop Weapon Familiarity|FPKrosmoz} ancestry feat.

ancestry.name: Cra
languages: {@language Common}

Additional languages equal to 1 + your Intelligence modifier (if it's positive). Choose from the list of common languages and any other languages to which you have access (such as the languages prevalent in your region).

features.name: Low-Light Vision
entries: You can see in dim light as though it were bright light, so you ignore the {@condition concealed} condition due to dim light.

info: It's hard to tell what's going on in a Cra's head when you're not one of them, but let's just say they seem to be gifted with the innate science of the projectile. A young Cra can shoot down a Moskito with spit weighed down by sugary sweets. The meetings behind the public urinal at the Trool Fair made Cras famous (because their jets are very long, if not the longest). Cra archers can carve a projectile out of just about any material, including the rarest ones, just by following their instinct. For instance, a Treechnid branch, once carved, can be of a surprising long range. Cras' craftsmanship became renowned thanks to their bow jobs, in which they take both pride and pleasure.

Hair blowing in the wind, slender silhouette, chiselled muscle structure, chest thrown out: the Cra disciple is proud, that's for sure. They are precious allies against melee attacks. Standing back from the ruckus, they shoot their feathered arrows into any opening left unattended, and they really hurt! That's why they're so popular for hunting and combat groups, in which they are known to have saved many allies. Of course, when Cras are forced to enter close combat, they find it harder to stand their ground... but you can't have it all!

items: Prefer to distance yourself from others.
Enjoy climbing into tall places just to enjoy the view.
Carefully scout a target or problem before striking at it quickly.
Respect your incredible sight.
Worry that you privately look down on them, or feel like you're condescending and aloof.
Assume that you'll be useless in a close quarters fight.

info.name: Physical Description
entries: Followers of Cra are about as tall as other average humans. Their eyes are often of a green colour, and are a Cra's joy and pride. Cras are often blonde or red-headed, with freckles sometimes adorning their face. Most Cra hairstyles are long but tied up in a variety ways (such as ponytails or braids), but some Cras may prefer to keep their hair short and simple.

Cras age at a similar rate to normal humans. Most Cras can live to be up to 80 years of age, but the more powerful Cras could live for nearly two centuries. Cras are more slender than the average human, and so tend to weigh less. The two predominant aesthetics in Cra clothing are full-body jumpsuits and skimpier tank tops with short pants or skirts, either style being often predominantly of a green or brown colour.

info.name: Society
entries: Societies in the World of Twelve are highly multicultural, and in them Cras often take on the jobs that require a good sight, such as hunters or lookouts. In particular, Cras will prefer to live in more structured and possibly hierarchical structures. All Cras may praise their god to different degrees, but their religion does not necessarily play an important role in the society they live in. Cras are very prideful and so may often look down upon others, such as Iops' for their simpleness, but they will respect anyone they deem can pull their own worth.

info.name: Alignment and Religion
entries: Followers of Cra tend to be of the Lawful alignment, with no real tendency towards good or evil. It is nonetheless not unheard of Cras who will fight against the establishment, such as Robbie Hoodie.

info.name: Names
entries: Most Cras have names that will roll off your tongue, often sounding elegant and exotic.

entries.name: Sample Names
entries: Evangelyne, Setsinbol, Robbie Hoodie, Edrige Valling, Kalisthe

heritage.name: Owl Eye Cra
entries: Your vision has adapted so even the darkest of nights cannot hinder it. You gain {@ability darkvision}.

heritage.name: Eagle Eye Cra
entries: There is nothing that your eyes cannot see, and your other senses aren't too far behind. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to locate {@condition undetected} creatures within 60 feet when using the {@action Seek} action. Your flat check to target {@condition concealed} creatures is DC {@flatDC 3} instead of DC {@flatDC 5}, and your flat check to target {@condition undetected} creatures is DC {@flatDC 9} instead of DC {@flatDC 11}.

ancestry.name: Sacrier
languages: {@language Common}

Additional languages equal to 1 + your Intelligence modifier (if it's positive). Choose from the list of common languages and any other languages to which you have access (such as the languages prevalent in your region).

features.name: Tattoo Mastery
entries: You can control the shape and size of any tattoo on your body. Additionally, tattoos do not automatically reduce the amount of items you can invest per day. You instead need to invest the tattoo using one action to {@action Interact} with it as per the {@action Invest an Item} action.

info: Sacriers are always on the lookout for other adventurers to fight with, even though their physical appearance doesn't always help - they're not exactly ugly... especially the girls... but they're not the best-looking class either, especially if you always trust first impressions. Meeting a Sacrier in the moonlight is an especially nerve-racking experience: his proud, muscular, sinewy silhouette, his forearms covered in a thick layer of blood, his glassy eyes gazing into yours... in short, you'd be better off on his side than against him! Fortunately for them, Sacriers have a great sense of humour. Grinning from ear to ear, a Sacri will never tire of asking you to hit him ("Go on! As hard as you can!") and is one of the rare examples of adventurers who will play the "Stop hitting yourself!" game all alone. In company, he'll delight everyone with his jokes about massacre and bloodshed, and his favourite party trick is juggling his enemies' organs. In short, he's a great guy to have around, and the perfect warrior companion!

Curious by nature, Sacriers are fascinated by anatomy. Spiteful gossips say it's actually an obsession, hence their reputation as weirdos (as admiring swollen muscles or the working of joints is pretty odd...). Sacriers are renowned for being caught poking and prodding at things and generally putting their fingers everywhere. Though their habits might seem confusing, they're very useful for the magic they practise!

They are naturally good butchers, since they have a passion for chopping meat, and gutting carcasses with their bare hands. If they embrace their spiritual path, they can become very clever soothsayers. As they do not fear blows or injuries, they are great on the front line and are very much appreciated by groups of adventurers.

items: Put other people's needs before your own.
Believe that what doesn't kill you makes you stronger.
Not mind getting your hands dirty.
Think you're creepy.
Consider you a masochist.
Entrust their lives to you.

info.name: Physical Description
entries: Followers of Sacrier are varied in their physical appearance. Many are tough and muscular, able to stop a sword with their abdominals, whereas others may be slim and focus on barely dodging to turn a deadly hit into a scratch. Their eyes look completely white and their nose small, sometimes almost imperceptible. The most common hair colour amongst sacriers is a deep orange, but white hair is also common, and bandanas are a very popular accessory. A Sacrier is only slightly taller than the average human on average.

Sacriers age at a similar rate to normal humans. Most Sacriers can live to be up to 80 years of age, but the more powerful Sacriers could live for nearly two centuries. Sacriers weigh the same as normal humans of similar physiques. Sacriers also favor going topless, showcasing the blood tattoos that cover their body, notably their arms and chest, and many of them mix their blood with ink during the process to colour their tattoos black instead of red. Due to this tendency of going topless, many Sacriers have a very tanned skin colour. The clothes that they do wear tend to look ragged.

info.name: Society
entries: Societies in the World of Twelve are highly multicultural, and in them Sacriers often take on the jobs that require getting their hands dirty. All Sacriers may praise their god to different degrees, but their religion does not necessarily play an important role in the society they live in. Most of them will create powerful bonds with other people and decide to protect them with their life.

info.name: Alignment and Religion
entries: Despite their protective nature often leading Sacriers into the Good alignment, it is not uncommon for their love for blood or the people they've bonded with to lead into Neutral or even Evil aligned Sacriers. For this same reason, Sacreirs have no tendency towards either Chaotic or Lawful alignments.

info.name: Names
entries: Most Sacriers have short names with violent-sounding consonants.

entries.name: Sample Names
entries: Katar, Lupa, Edass, Saketsu, Kali, Kriss the Krass, Denn Kratz

heritage.name: Heartful Sacrier
entries: A Sacrier keeps going as long as their heart keeps pumping blood. You gain 12 Hit Points from your ancestry instead of 10. You also gain the {@feat Diehard} feat.

heritage.name: Angered Sacrier
entries: Anger can be a Sacrier's greatest drive, bringing them unparalleled power. Choose either the {@archetype Cathartic Mage|SoM|Cathartic Mage (Anger)} or the {@archetype Runelord|SoM|Runelord (Wrath)} Archetype. You gain the archetype's dedication feat, even though you don't meet its level prerequisite. You must still meet its other prerequisites to gain the feat.

ancestry.name: Eniripsa
languages: {@language Common}

Additional languages equal to 1 + your Intelligence modifier (if it's positive). Choose from the list of common languages and any other languages to which you have access (such as the languages prevalent in your region).
info: Whereas most adventurers cross the World with the hope of punching you in the face, the Eniripsas use their hands for something completely different: they heal the good, the bad and sometimes (actually, often) even the ugly!

With one hand on their hearts and the other cupped like a megaphone, Eniripsas base their magic on words which can heal or hurt according to their needs. Needless to say, when they open their mouths, everyone listens carefully...

Although they are often very adept at alchemy, most Eniripsa magic relies on their Words, which have become famous all around the World. Some are famous for their "good words" and others for their "bad words". Some Eniripsas even become word hunters, collecting verbs and foraging for forgotten languages. Eniripsas are often seen talking to shady and disreputable people, but they're just trying to get precious vocabulary from them...

items: Care for other people's wellbeing.
Have an interest in poisons and elixirs.
Love experimenting with anything you get your hands on.
Assume you cannot defend yourself.
Think you are too kind for your own good.
Rely greatly on your treatments.

info.name: Physical Description
entries: Followers of Eniripsa tend to be small and thin. They do not have very distinctive features other than the wings on their back. Some may possess strikingly beautiful insect wings, whereas others grew dark and somber bat wings, and albeit very rare there are cases of Eniripsas with feathery wings. A normally tall Eniripsa is usually still as tall as the average human, but the shorter ones could be even just 4 feet tall.

Eniripsas age at a similar rate to normal humans. Most Eniripsas can live to be up to 80 years of age, but the more powerful Eniripsas could live for nearly two centuries. Eniripsas are lighter than a human of similar physique, but sometimes the weight of the wings can even that. Eniripsas usually wear sleeveless clothing and prefer baggy pants and short skirts. They sometimes wear detached fabric sleeves to cover their arms.

info.name: Society
entries: Societies in the World of Twelve are highly multicultural, and in them Eniripsas often take on the jobs that require tact and care. All Eniripsas may praise their god to different degrees, but their religion does not necessarily play an important role in the society they live in. Most of them will try to help their peers whenever they can, and have great respect for alchemists.

info.name: Alignment and Religion
entries: Due to their good faith Eniripsas are often of the Good alignment. Nonetheless Eniripsas also do not usually discriminate when it comes to helping, and may also believe that ends justify their means. Due to their experimental nature they also lean towards the Chaotic alignment.

info.name: Names
entries: Most Eniripsas have short and even sweet-sounding names.

entries.name: Sample Names
entries: Lily, Vax, Nabrisa, Brumen, Skeunk, Echo

heritage.name: Soothing Eniripsa
entries: Healing is a way of life. An Eniripsa must know how to treat wounds with utmost care, be it their own or anyone else's. When anyone uses the {@skill Medicine} skill to {@action Treat Wounds} you add your level to the Hit Points regained.

heritage.name: Skywalker Eniripsa
entries: Your bones are lighter and you can open your wings to slow your descent through the air. You take no damage from falling, regardless of the distance you fall.

ancestry.name: Sram
languages: {@language Common}

Additional languages equal to 1 + your Intelligence modifier (if it's positive). Choose from the list of common languages and any other languages to which you have access (such as the languages prevalent in your region).

features.name: Low-Light Vision
entries: You can see in dim light as though it were bright light, and you ignore the {@condition concealed} condition due to dim light.

features.name: Skull Mask
entries: You gain one skull mask for free, as it was given to you at the time of your initiation as a Sram. Selling this mask is a terrible taboo and earns you the disdain of other Sram's.

info: Beware of any Srams who seem to be sending sneaky glances your way. Before you know it, you'll be stripped of your cherished belongings, especially the most expensive ones! If you only learn one thing about followers of the skull-headed god, let it be this: they love everything that dangles, especially rounded pouches... They're also always on the lookout for loose tongues, because anyone who might be a source of useful information interests them... Riffling through the tails of a tunic, feeling the bottom of a pocket, exercising their nimble fingers, and finally holding long-desired jewels in their hands are just a few of a Sram's favourite things.
Robbers, pilferers, shoplifters, snatchers, plunderers and cheaters! They are often where we don't want to see them: in bank vaults, dark alleyways and at the end of our pouch strings.

To master their art, Srams submit themselves to a severe training regime that would make mere mortals go white with fear. To be honest, when Srams first find out about it, they go white with fear too, but since they have such a pale complexion, no one notices. The neophyte's aim is to become extremely supple and to control his senses and his Chakras perfectly. Believe me, it can be really useful! Mastering this art will enable him to dislocate a joint so as to voluntarily sneak into very narrow places. Srams are not afraid of tight spaces... as long as there are kamas hidden inside. This set of secret techniques is called the Kama Sutars.

items: Enjoy the night over the day.
Feel an affinity to the undead.
Love to see someone fall into one of your traps.
Assume you are a loner.
Feel unnerved by your presence.
Respect your skills.

info.name: Physical Description
entries: Followers of Sram tend to be skeletally thin, often even literally. They are either walking skeletons, wear skull masks, or simply wear predominantly bone-themed clothing. Although much lighter, a Sram is usually not taller than the average human.

Srams age at a similar rate to normal humans, although it is often not very noticeable. Most Srams live to be up to 80 years of age, but the most powerful Srams could live for nearly two centuries. Srams tend to wear either very little clothing, or a full body suit, with very little in between.

info.name: Society
entries: Societies in the World of Twelve are highly multicultural, and in them Srams often take on the jobs that require diligence and discretion. All Srams may praise their god to different degrees, but their religion does not necessarily play an important role in the society they live in. Most of them will do sketchy jobs, or turn to crime.

info.name: Alignment and Religion
entries: Due to their criminal tendencies Srams are often of the Chaotic alignment, but many still find their slyness of better use in more Lawful ways. Despite appearances, there is no real tendency towards Evil, and neither towards Good, but towards neutrality.

info.name: Names
entries: Srams have very varied names, often choosing a name for themselves.

entries.name: Sample Names
entries: Ejipe, Ogivol, Rebecca, Erazal, Oscar Kass, Gein, Toxine, Maude

heritage.name: Shadowed Sram
entries: You live in the shadows and so your sight has adapted to dark environments. You gain {@ability darkvision}.

heritage.name: Cadaverous Sram
entries: You are as light as a feather, giving you incredible agility. Your Speed increases from 25 to 30 feet.

ancestry.name: Xelor
languages: {@language Common}

Additional languages equal to 1 + your Intelligence modifier (if it's positive). Choose from the list of common languages and any other languages to which you have access (such as the languages prevalent in your region).

features.name: Low-Light Vision
entries: You can see in dim light as though it were bright light, and you ignore the {@condition concealed} condition due to dim light.

features.name: Skull Mask
entries: You gain one skull mask for free, as it was given to you at the time of your initiation as a Sram. Selling this mask is a terrible taboo and earns you the disdain of other Sram's.

info: Xelor's worshippers venerate everything to do with telling the time: clocks, chimes, hands and so on. They consider all timepieces to be representations of Xelor himself... although some apparently think that they are also reincarnations of their ancestors... Scholars still haven't got to the bottom of this strange group which plays with time like children play with ants and magnifying glasses. At least they don't have to worry about being on time for appointments!

Xelor disciples protect their bodies from the danger of time warps with bandages. This process is important for a number of reasons. The slightest crack between two wrappings could create a major mishap: any part of their body which is not bandaged can't travel in time at the same speed as the rest of the body! A lapse in concentration could cost them dearly. Now we know why Xelors dress so modestly! Xelors are often appreciated within groups of adventurers as they can increase their allies' ability to act.

items: Be precise about every single detail.
Always keep track of the pass of time at any moment.
Instinctively process large amounts of disparate information quickly and efficiently.
Assume you have secret knowledge about magic and technology.
Think you'll go mad at any moment.
Look to you as the expert on any matters involving time or machinery.

info.name: Physical Description
entries: Followers of Xelor tend to be short. They completely cover themselves with bandages to safely practice time magic, so their physical features are hidden most of the time, but they do not have any distinguishing features under the bandages.  A normally tall Xelor is usually still as tall as the average human, but the shorter ones could be even just 4 feet tall.

Xelors age at a similar rate to normal humans, but can live longer through the use of time magic. Most Xelors can live up to 100 years of age, but the more powerful Xelors could live for various centuries. Xelors weigh the same as normal humans of similar physique. There are two predominant Xelor aesthetics, some simple, comfortable and often baggy clothes and wear big hats, whereas others prefer wearing metallic faceplates and pieces of armor.

info.name: Society
entries: Societies in the World of Twelve are highly multicultural, and in them Xelors often take on the jobs that require research and precision. All Xelors may praise their god to different degrees, but their religion does not necessarily play an important role in the society they live in. Most of them will take on investigative or quiet and peaceful jobs.

info.name: Alignment and Religion
entries: Many Xelors tend to be neutral by nature, considering the world to be just a very small part of the Krosmoz and distancing themselves from the troubles of humankind, but they are not a majority. Some Xelors may find Time to be a symbol of order and feel an affinity to the Lawful alignment, whereas others may find Time to be a symbol of unpredictability and feel an affinity to the Chaotic alignment. As for the good and evil alignments, there are many records of infamous evil Xelors, but the average Xelor has no real tendency towards each side.

info.name: Names
entries: Xelors have very varied names, sometimes very short, sometimes long and complicated.

entries.name: Sample Names
entries: Amine, Methea, Jacquemart Astron, Kya, Many, Kwartzwatch, Noximilien

heritage.name: Watcher Xelor
entries: You can easily detect and understand magical phenomena. You can cast the {@spell detect magic} cantrip as a divine innate spell at will. A cantrip is heightened to a spell level equal to half your level rounded up. In addition, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to checks to {@action Identify Magic} and to {@action Decipher Writing} of a magical nature. These skill actions typically use the {@skill Arcana}, {@skill Nature}, {@skill Occultism}, or {@skill Religion} skill.

heritage.name: Studious Xelor
entries: Your magic is more connected to your mind than it is to your faith. Choose {@filter arcane|spells||Level=0|Tradition & Spell List=Arcane} or {@filter occult|spells||Level=0|Tradition & Spell List=Occult}. You gain one cantrip from that magical tradition's spell list. You can cast this spell as an innate spell at will, as a spell of your chosen tradition. A cantrip is heightened to a spell level equal to half your level rounded up. Whenever you gain a divine innate spell from a xelor ancestry feat, change its tradition from divine to your chosen tradition.

ancestry.name: Sadida
languages: {@language Common}

Additional languages equal to 1 + your Intelligence modifier (if it's positive). Choose from the list of common languages and any other languages to which you have access (such as the languages prevalent in your region).
info: The followers of the god Sadida are gathered under the name "Sadida's Shoe," which means, in Sadida language, "Those whose shoes, soled with wind and laced with greenery, can create dew and joy within the god Sadida's heart, from the innermost depths to the edge of the forests, scented with exquisite and musky fragrances." This funny expression always puzzles people. The first thing you need to know about Sadidas is that they're extremely touchy when it comes to the soles of their feet. Some people say they're hard with calluses, while others say that it's the most sensitive part of their body. It might also be to do with the smell. But no one knows for sure except the Sadidas themselves. Of course, if you ask one of the leafy god's temperamental followers yourself, you'll regret it. In the end, it's your choice: live in ignorance, or run the risk of getting a thorny whack in the privates. Not hard to choose, is it?

We often think Sadidas sleep all day long. The truth is, what we believe to be deep sleep is in fact a very intense activity similar to dreaming... Sadidas claim they are "dream-passers." A dreaming Sadida can make a tremendous effort in the ether to harness the energies that will bring their dolls to life. They are also fond of the teachings spread by forest spirits and lesser gods. They advise the Sadida where to find the plants he needs to make their ointments and poisons. This vegetative condition enables them to converse with plants and trees. If a Sadida needs to pick up a plant or cut down a tree, they will always ask its permission, as a Sadida is in perfect harmony with Nature. Some reckon they also take special care to do it because they have the power to change into a tree and that there's something not quite right about hitting a peer with an axe.

Some Sadidas set themselves up as protectors of the land. They use their Sylvan Power spell, which enables them to change into a tree, to melt into the background and remain watchful, scanning their surroundings. Ever felt like someone's watching you when you're in a supposedly deserted forest? Now you know why!

items: Feel a deep connection to plants and vegetation.
Like playing with dolls.
Oversleep nearly every day.
Think you are lazy.
Consider your dolls to be creepy.
Believe you are invincible in a jungle.

info.name: Physical Description
entries: Followers of Sadida are about as tall as other average humans of similar physique. They most often have dark skin and brown eyes, and characteristically green-coloured hair. Rarely do they cut their hair short, to the point where it covers their entire face or drag it on the ground behind them.

Sadidas age at a similar rate to normal humans. Most Sadidas can live to be up to 80 years of age, but the more powerful Sadidas could live for nearly two centuries. Sadidas weigh the same as normal humans of similar physique. Many Sadida cultures prefer to clothe skimpily wearing fundoshis, bikinis, tube tops, or going topless, and even walk barefoot.

info.name: Society
entries: Societies in the World of Twelve are highly multicultural, and in them Sadidas often take on the jobs that involve plants. All Sadidas may praise their god to different degrees, but their religion does not necessarily play an important role in the society they live in. Sadidas make great botanists and gardeners, or at least good enough to overlook their habit of sleeping during work hours. Others prefer to craft toys and other childrens' toys. It is also not uncommon for a Sadida to live away from society, in a forest or jungle, where they can be in close contact with their god and sleep to their heart's desire.

info.name: Alignment and Religion
entries: Sadidas generally do not lean towards any alignment, but neutral would be the most common one, as Sadidas may try to act closest to how they believe Nature acts. Nature does not know of concepts such as good or evil, and although some would say the wilderness is chaotic and untamed, others would say that it follows its own laws and rules.

info.name: Names
entries: Sadida names are often simple, sometimes referencing elements of nature.

entries.name: Sample Names
entries: Leaf, Epoup Tik, Aurore, Li Crounch, Yova Etna, Sadadi Sama, Amalia, Armand

heritage.name: Forestal Sadida
entries: You've lived your life surrounded by wild plants and can move around them freely. You can ignore difficult terrain and uneven ground caused by undergrowth. In addition, when you use the {@skill Acrobatics} skill to {@action Balance} on narrow surfaces or uneven ground within forests, you aren't {@condition flat-footed}. When you roll a success attempting one of these {@skill Acrobatics} checks, you get a critical success instead.

heritage.name: Wildsoul Sadida
entries: Your connection to the Tree of Life and the Leafy God is greater than most. You gain one {@filter cantrip|spells||Level=0|Tradition & Spell List=Primal} from that primal spell list. You can cast this spell as an innate primal spell at will. A cantrip is heightened to a spell level equal to half your level rounded up. Whenever you gain a divine innate spell from a sadida ancestry feat, change its tradition from {@trait divine} to {@trait primal}.

ancestry.name: Ecaflip
languages: {@language Common}

Additional languages equal to 1 + your Intelligence modifier (if it's positive). Choose from the list of common languages and any other languages to which you have access (such as the languages prevalent in your region).

features.name: Low-Light Vision
entries: You can see in dim light as though it were bright light, and you ignore the {@condition concealed} condition due to dim light.

info: What's the life of a disciple of Ecaflip like? It's a life of getting into sticky situations, landing a windfall and then swiftly losing just as much if not more... If you're in a tavern and you hear somebody betting kamas, you can be sure there's an Ecaflip around, he'll either be betting or looking carefully at the scene, rolling a coin between his fingers... A happy Ecaflip gambles all the time, for everything and for nothing - but be careful, he takes gambling very seriously. He can even risk his life on a throw of the dice. Do you know anyone that crazy? Pretty sure I don't.

The Ecaflip mind set is clear on one thing: there's no such thing as a coincidence. To the layman, they appear to leave things to good fortune or misfortune, but the Ecaflip disciple knows that when he decides to play, it's his destiny!

Ecaflips are great warriors skilled in both team fights and solo fights. It ought to be noted, though, that if an Ecaflip is going to fight with other adventurers, his teammates would do well to have a similar life philosophy... Although Ecaflip magic is renowned for its destructive powers, it is also governed by the laws of fate and can backfire on the allies that it's supposed to support, hence the misunderstandings and even the insults exchanged on battlefields. It's true that when an Ecaflip prepares to cast "All or Nothing", it can be quite harrowing for both enemies and allies!

items: Live for the thrill.
Like to leave everything to luck.
Love playing all kinds of games.
Think you can't take anything seriously.
Fear your gambles will put them in risk.
Find you very fun to have around.

info.name: Physical Description
entries: Followers of Ecaflip are about as tall as other average humans of similar physique. They have the appearance of anthropomorphic felines, with cat ears, a tail, and covered in fur of a variety of colours. Some ecaflips also grow hair on top of their fur, styling it in many ways like ponytails, twintails, and braids.

Ecaflips age at a similar rate to normal humans. Most Ecaflips can live to be up to 80 years of age, but the more powerful Ecaflips could live for nearly two centuries. Ecaflips weigh the same as normal humans of similar physique. Ecaflips like comfortable clothing above all, such as bell trousers, sometimes leading to very skimpy clothing, like going topless, wearing bikini tops and hotpants, or even naked aprons.

info.name: Society
entries: Societies in the World of Twelve are highly multicultural, and in them Ecaflips often take on the jobs that involve games or taking risks. All Ecaflips may praise their god to different degrees, but their religion does not necessarily play an important role in the society they live in. Ecaflips often work as street performers or as dealers in betting houses. But it is just as common for Ecaflips to live solely from gambling, leaving many of them indebted.

info.name: Alignment and Religion
entries: Ecaflips have a natural tendency towards the Chaotic alignment due to their unpredictability and reliance on luck, but they are not necessarily a majority. Other more Lawful-aligned Ecaflips may focus on the aspect of Fate rather than Luck. There is nonetheless no clear tendency towards either the Good or Evil alignments.

info.name: Names
entries: Ecaflip names are often short names, similar to those a pet bow meow would have.

entries.name: Sample Names
entries: Dodge, Ulette, Hersa, Kerub, Atcham, Julie, Ush, Ashante, Nomekop, Rysk, Miranda

heritage.name: Clawed Ecaflip
entries: You possess particularly long, sharp claws capable of delivering bleeding wounds with a wicked swipe. You gain a claw unarmed attack that deals {@damage 1d6} slashing damage. Your claws are in the {@group brawling} group and have the {@trait agile}, {@trait finesse}, and {@trait unarmed} traits.

heritage.name: Nine Lives Ecaflip
entries: You always seem to bounce back from disaster, not through physical hardiness or specialized skill, but from sheer luck. If you are reduced to 0 Hit Points by a critical hit on an attack roll, you become {@condition dying 1} instead of {@condition dying 2}.

ancestry.name: Pandawa
languages: {@language Common}

Additional languages equal to 1 + your Intelligence modifier (if it's positive). Choose from the list of common languages and any other languages to which you have access (such as the languages prevalent in your region).
info: The eternally thirsty goddess Pandawa made her disciples in her image, and they can really knock one back! They master the art of emptying a beer mug, a tankard or a pint glass perfectly, and it does them good! Once it reaches the drunken state, a Pandawa can go wild and do anything with their body! They can even do anything with others' bodies, both good and bad. It all depends on whose side you're on...

Pandawas are much appreciated for their unusual martial arts techniques. Although they seem to be drunk, they can get one over on you, one moment escaping like water running through stones, the next smashing skulls like a brute! Handy with axes, and gifted with an unfailing sense of humour, they take every chance they can get to fight, even if it's just for a laugh. Those who persevere in the martial arts path become great masters and people travel from far-off lands to learn their teachings.

items: Love to drink and party.
Have great interest in martial arts or spiritualism.
Spend more time inebriated than sober.
Believe you are the life of the party.
See you as nothing more than a drunkard.
Admire your physical and mental flexibility.

info.name: Physical Description
entries: Followers of Pandawa are about as tall as other average humans of similar physique. They have the appearance of anthropomorphic panda bears, with fluffy bear ears, and covered in two-toned fur, nearly always black and white. A few Pandawas also grow hair on top of their fur, but most do not.

Pandawas age at a similar rate to normal humans. Most Pandawas can live to be up to 80 years of age, but the more powerful Pandawas could live for nearly two centuries. Pandawas weigh the same as normal humans of similar physique, and are often stronger than they look. Pandawas wear a gi, kimono, hanfu, or variations of the like. These clothes are usually red or black in colour, decorated with pieces of bamboo (sometimes containing emergency bamboo milk). Their preferred footwear are sandals.

info.name: Society
entries: Societies in the World of Twelve are highly multicultural, and in them Pandawas often take on the jobs that involve physical fitness or that are in close proximity to alcohol. All Pandawas may praise their god to different degrees, but their religion does not necessarily play an important role in the society they live in. Pandawas often work as warriors or lumberjacks, although the ones with some self-restraint may decide to work at a bar as bartender or waiter. Those with no self-restraint may end up living as the town's local drunkard.

info.name: Alignment and Religion
entries: Pandawas with roots on Pandala may be practitioners of Pandawushu, leading them towards True Neutral or adjacent alignments, seeking perfect balance of the self. Otherwise, Pandawas do not have any tendency towards any particular alignment, although many may believe them to lean towards Chaotic due to their drunken lifestyle.

info.name: Names
entries: Pandawa names are often syllabic or share parts of it with their goddess's name.

entries.name: Sample Names
entries: Zatoishwan, Damadrya, Grandapan, Hikomi, Tofugawa, Danaba Retzu, Surivitna, Pandiego

heritage.name: Blood Alcohol Pandawa
entries: Your body is used to housing exorbitant amounts of alcohol in your veins, which luckily also gives you a greater resistance to the effects of other poisons. You gain poison resistance equal to half your level (minimum 1), and each of your successful saving throws against a poison affliction reduces its stage by 2, or by 1 for a virulent poison. Each critical success against an ongoing poison reduces its stage by 3, or by 2 for a virulent poison.

heritage.name: Carrier Pandawa
entries: You often carry heavy loads on your shoulders. You become trained in {@skill Athletics} (or another skill if you're already trained in {@skill Athletics}), and you gain the {@feat Hefty Hauler} skill feat.

ancestry.name: Osamodas
languages: {@language Common}

Additional languages equal to 1 + your Intelligence modifier (if it's positive). Choose from the list of common languages and any other languages to which you have access (such as the languages prevalent in your region).
info: Osamodas are probably the only adventurers who can spend time in the Evil Forest at night without being scared of the ominous cries that echo through the trees. Cawing Crows? Whispering Evil Tofus? Winking eyes? Nope, nothing scares them, because they know everything about all creatures. They can read the hearts of beasts like open books. Any creature endowed with an ounce of common sense will avoid an Osamodas' gaze for fear of surrendering itself to him. After all, who knows what an Osamodas might do with a captured creature...

Osamodas's followers have a power that anyone would love to have: they can summon creatures and use them in fights. It's rumoured that these excellent tamers cut their clothes from the skin of their enemies, but you'll have to ask an Osamodas whether it's true or not... And you'll see for yourself when you end up as a boot or a fur-lined beanie!

Osamodas claim they are distantly related to dragons, and it's true that their tails are quite dragon-like, as are their horns and breath. These attributes all help them to win the trust of animals more easily. Osamodas's worshippers venerate dragons and there are statues of the magical creatures adorning the entrance to their temple. Their god doesn't take offence at this since he likes them too! As a matter of fact, some of his followers can even summon a Wyrmling. To their owners' great joy, these young Dragons can crush enemies to pulp any day of the week, except Sunday, when they'll be turned into roasted kebabs, as this is the traditional feasting day.

items: Prefer the company of animals over people.
Try to assert dominance over others.
Maintain composure when faced with strange creatures.
Think you love your pets too much.
Ask for your help with any animal-related problem.
Consider your claims of draconic power to be overblown, delusional, or endearing.

info.name: Physical Description
entries: Followers of Sadida are about as tall as other average humans of similar physique. They have small horns on their head and usually have a slim arrow-shaped tail on their back. Their hair is often of a very light colour, or even white. Their hairstyles are often short or shoulder-length, and often they also prefer shaving their head and decorating their forehead with a paw-print tattoo or similar. Sometimes, usually when living in symbiosis with a Gobgob, an Osamodas's skin is of a particular colour, most commonly blue.

Osamodas age at a similar rate to normal humans. Most Osamodas can live to be up to 80 years of age, but the more powerful Osamodas could live for nearly two centuries. Osamodas weigh the same as normal humans of similar physique. Some Osamodas like wearing sleeveless shirts and baggy shorts or skirts, often wearing a large belt with a paw-print buckle. But another common Osamodas fashion turns around fluffy fur-based accessories and hand-sewn shorts and leotards.

info.name: Society
entries: Societies in the World of Twelve are highly multicultural, and in them Osamodas often take on the jobs that involve taming and taking care of animals. All Osamodas may praise their god to different degrees, but their religion does not necessarily play an important role in the society they live in. Osamodas often work as beast tamers or veterinarians.

info.name: Alignment and Religion
entries: Osamodas do not tend towards any alignment, some of them even living free of such concepts as they believe dragons to be. It is not uncommon nontheless for more bestial Osamodas to lean toward the Chaotic alignments.

info.name: Names
entries: Osamodas names are varied, but sometimes refer to other creatures.

entries.name: Sample Names
entries: Simone, Abrazelon Sixgriffe, Furye, Bethel Akarna, Lethaline, Toh'Lo, Mishell, Kabrok, Aurora

heritage.name: Symbiotic Osamodas
entries: You are magically bonded to a small star-shaped creature named the Gobgob and live in symbiosis with it. You gain a {@filter familiar|companionsfamiliars||Type=Familiar}, and this familiar must be a gobgob. It still gets the benefits of familiar abilities, but its base form remains a gobgob.

heritage.name: Taskmaster Osamodas
entries: You come from a long line of tamers who commanded animals. You gain the {@feat Group Coercion} skill feat. If you roll a success on an {@skill Intimidation} check to {@action Coerce} an animal of lower level than you, you get a critical success instead; if you roll a critical failure, you get a failure instead.

feat.name: Awakened Aide
entries: You can now grant your living tools greater sentience to help you in your endeavors. You learn the {@ritual Awaken Object} ritual and gain a +2 circumstance bonus to all primary checks to perform it.

feat.name: Magnificent Mansion
entries: You have access to your very own and secure haven mansion where you can keep your treasures safe. You can cast {@spell Magnificent Mansion} as a 7th-level divine innate spell once per day.

feat.name: Drhellzerker Form
entries: You touch your Drheller companion and fuse with them to become a Drhellzerker. Your Dhreller companion disappears, and you cast {@spell Animal Form} as a 5th-level divine innate spell using the statistics and abilities of the cat battle form, except you can use your humanoid form's AC if it's higher than what the animal form grants. When the spell ends, your Drheller companion reappears adjacent to you.
You gain additional benefits if you have the following feats:

items: {@feat Mature Drheller|FPKrosmoz}: When in Drhellzerker Form you gain a burrowing speed of 20 feet.
{@feat Incredible Drheller|FPKrosmoz}: When in Drhellzerker Form, you gain your Drheller's Badger Rage action.
{@feat Specialized Drheller|FPKrosmoz}: When in Drhellzerker Form, you gain your Drheller's specializations.

feat.name: Telluric Strikes
entries: You channel strength from the earth beneath your feet to pummel your enemies. When making a melee {@action Strike} against a target who is standing on the same earth or stone surface as you are, you gain a circumstance bonus to the damage roll equal to the number of weapon damage dice.

feat.name: Specialized Drheller
entries: Your Drheller companion continues to grow in power and ability, and it is now cunning enough to become specialized. Your animal companion gains one specialization of your choice.
feat.special: You can select this feat up to two times. Each time, add a different specialization to your companion.

feat.name: Hidden Chest
entries: There is no safer place for your greatest riches than a pocket dimension. You can cast the {@spell Secret Chest|Apg} at 5th level as an innate divine spell.

feat.name: Animated Aide
entries: You have learned a way to bring your trusty digging tools, bags, and chests to life. You learn the {@ritual Animate Object} ritual and gain a +2 circumstance bonus to all primary checks to perform it.

feat.name: Enutrof Weapon Expertise
entries: Whenever you gain a class feature that grants you expert or greater proficiency in certain weapons, you also gain that proficiency rank in all weapons you are trained in from {@feat Enutrof Weapon Familiarity|FPKrosmoz}.

feat.name: Incredible Drheller
entries: Your Drheller companion continues to grow and develop. It becomes a nimble or savage animal companion (your choice), gaining additional capabilities determined by the type of companion.

feat.name: Enutrof Magic
entries: You channel Enutrof's prosperous magic. You can cast {@spell Charitable Urge|APG} and {@spell Phantasmal Treasure|APG} each once per day as 2nd-level divine innate spells.

feat.name: Ancient Spells
entries: You unlock new magical potential in your old bones. You can cast {@spell Day's Weight|SoM} and {@spell Locate} each once per day as 2nd-level divine innate spells.

feat.name: Advanced Geology
feat.requirements: You are standing on a stone or earthen surface.
entries: You grow a connection to the earth at your feet. Until the start of your next turn, you gain a new sense: imprecise {@ability tremorsense} with a range of 20 feet.

feat.name: Mature Drheller
entries: Your Drheller companion grows up, becoming a mature animal companion and gaining additional capabilities. During an encounter, even if you don't use the {@action Command an Animal} action, your animal companion can still use 1 action on your turn to either {@action Stride} or {@action Strike}.

feat.name: Enutrof Weapon Scour
entries: Your vivacity with enutrof weapons is unrivaled. Whenever you critically hit using one of the weapons from your {@feat Enutrof Weapon Familiarity|FPKrosmoz}, you apply the weapon's critical specialization effect.

feat.name: Seismic Shake
entries: You have the power to shake and shatter the earth around you. You crack the ground beneath you, creating difficult terrain in a 5-foot burst centered on one corner of your space.

feat.name: Clumsiness
entries: You hinder the opponent's movements to gain the upper hand. You can cast {@spell befuddle|LOGM} once per day as a 1st-level divine innate spell.

feat.name: Cancel Fortune
feat.trigger: A creature within 60 feet uses a {@trait fortune} or {@trait misfortune} effect.
entries: As someone attempts to twist fate against you or in their favor, you even the ground.

The triggering effect is disrupted. If it's a {@trait misfortune} effect, Cancel Fortune gains the {@trait fortune} trait; if it's a {@trait fortune} effect, Cancel Fortune gains the {@trait misfortune} trait. This {@trait fortune} or {@trait misfortune} applies to the same roll the triggering effect would have, so you couldn't negate a {@trait fortune} effect with Cancel Fortune and then apply a {@trait misfortune} effect to the same roll.

feat.name: Dogged Scrutiny
entries: You can't rush things, not when there's potential riches to be found. You can voluntarily spend twice as much time as normal on a Perception check or skill check to gain a +2 circumstance bonus to that check. You also don't treat a natural 1 as worse than usual on these checks; you get a critical failure only if your result is 10 lower than the DC. For example, you could get these benefits if you spent 2 actions to Seek, which normally takes 1 action. You can get these benefits during exploration by taking twice as long exploring as normal, or in downtime by spending twice as much downtime.
The GM might determine a situation doesn't grant you a benefit if a delay would be directly counterproductive to your success, such as a tense negotiation with an impatient creature.

feat.name: Prospector
entries: You've spent a lifetime searching for precious gems underground, you have learned to find your way without landmarks or even solid ground. If you roll a success on an {@skill Survival} check to {@action Sense Direction} or an {@skill Athletics} check to {@action Climb}, you get a critical success instead. You're not {@condition flat-footed} when you attempt to {@action Climb}.

feat.name: Finder's Eyes
entries: You're always on the lookout for treasure. Each time you use the {@action Seek} action to search for objects (including secret doors and hazards), you can search for objects in your choice of a 10-foot emanation around you or an adjacent 15-foot-by-15-foot area, rather than a single adjacent 10-foot-by-10-foot area.

feat.name: Eye for Craftsmanship
entries: You can recognize good quality when you see it. You become trained in {@skill Crafting} and gain a +1 circumstance bonus on all {@skill Crafting} checks made to {@action Recall Knowledge}.

If you would automatically become trained in {@skill Crafting} (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. In addition, you gain the {@feat Crafter's Appraisal} skill feat, enabling you to identify magic items using the {@skill Crafting} skill.

feat.name: Enutrof Weapon Familiarity
entries: An Enutrof can turn their digging tools into a perfect weapon. You are trained with the {@item staff}, {@item light pick}, {@item pick}, {@item sword cane}, and {@item polytool}. In addition, you gain access to {@item polytool||polytools} and all {@filter uncommon enutrof weapons|items||Category=Weapon|Rarity=Uncommon|Ancestry & Heritage=enutrof}. For the purpose of determining your proficiency, martial enutrof weapons are simple weapons and advanced enutrof weapons are martial weapons.

feat.name: Enutrof's Fingers Lore
entries: You have lived the life that Enutrof intended, following all of his tenets. You gain the trained proficiency in your choice of {@skill Diplomacy} and either {@skill Deception} or {@skill Society}. If you would automatically become trained in one of those skills (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You also become trained in {@skill Lore||Enutrof Lore}.

feat.name: Driving Ambition
entries: You aim to be the best at what you do, and earn the greatest profit from it. You gain a 1st-level class feat for your class. You must meet the prerequisites, but you can select the feat later in the character creation process in order to determine which prerequisites you meet.

feat.name: Drheller Companion
entries: You can summon your own Drheller to help you find new treasures. You gain an Animal Companion, and it uses the {@companion Badger} stat block.

feat.name: Time Distortion
entries: Your time magic expertise allows you to teleport in a series of quick jumps rather than in one big leap. You can expend your hourly use of {@spell dimension door} as a free action when you begin your turn. If you do, your {@action Stride||Strides} are augmented until the end of your turn, allowing you to instantly teleport to any point you could reach with your Speed instead of traversing normally to the location. While augmented, your {@action Stride||Strides} gain the {@trait conjuration} and {@trait teleportation} traits. Your augmented {@action Stride||Strides} don't trigger reactions that can be triggered by {@trait move} actions or upon leaving or entering a square, unless those reactions trigger on teleportation.

feat.name: Rhol Bak
entries: You create a savepoint in time to come back if things go wrong in the future. You can cast {@spell Time Beacon|LOGM} as a 7th-level divine innate spell once per day.

feat.name: Desynchronization
entries: You can send an opponent directly into the timestream. You can cast {@spell Cast into Time|SoM} as a 7th-level divine innate spell once per day.

feat.name: Xelorium Bound
entries: The connection between you and Xelor's realm resonates within your soul stronger than it does for most xelors, allowing you to cross the threshold between the {@plane Material Plane} and {@plane Xelorium}. You gain {@spell plane shift} as a divine innate spell. You can cast it twice per week. This can be used only to travel back and forth between {@plane Xelorium} (or the {@plane First World}) and the {@plane Material Plane}. Due to your body's natural resonance, you can act as the spell focus, and you don't require a tuning fork.

feat.name: Xelor Spell Expertise
entries: Your affinity to divine time magic grows deeper. During your daily preparations, choose {@spell Blink Charge|SoM}, {@spell Inevitable Disaster|SoM} or {@spell Rewinding Step|SoM}. You can {@action Cast a Spell||Cast this Spell} as a 5th-level divine innate spell once that day. You become an expert in divine spell DCs and divine spell attack rolls.

feat.name: Xelor Weapon Expertise
entries: Whenever you gain a class feature that grants you expert or greater proficiency in certain weapons, you also gain that proficiency rank in all weapons you are trained in from {@feat Xelor Weapon Familiarity|FPKrosmoz}.

feat.name: Time Rift
entries: You create a time rift to teleport yourself to safety. Once per day, you can cast {@spell dimension door} as a 5th-level divine innate spell.

feat.name: Time Magic
entries: You control powerful time magic. Each day, you can cast two 4th-level divine innate spells. You can choose from the following spells each time you cast: {@spell Tortoise and the Hare|Som}, {@spell Curse of Lost Time|apg}, {@spell Perseis's Precautions|LOPSG}.

feat.name: Xelor Magic
entries: You channel Xelor's furtive magic. You can cast {@spell Sudden Blight|APG} and {@spell Gentle Repose} each once per day as 2nd-level divine innate spells.

feat.name: Violent Omens
entries: Once per day, you can spend 10 minutes studying your surroundings in search of omens related to a particular course of action to cast {@spell augury} as an innate divine spell. Unless the result of the {@spell augury} was "nothing," you gain the following reaction for the next 30 minutes:

entries.name: Premonition
entries.trigger: You attempt an attack roll, skill check, or saving throw while performing the course of action from your {@spell augury}, but you haven't rolled yet
entries: You gain a +1 status bonus to the triggering check, or a +2 status bonus if the result of the augury was "woe" and you proceeded anyway.

feat.name: Temporal Distortion
entries: You can create a small distortion in time. You can cast 3rd level {@spell time jump} once per day as a divine innate spell.

feat.name: Read the Timestream
feat.prerequisite: trained in {@skill Lore||Astrology Lore} or {@skill Occultism}
entries: You're incredibly skilled in reading the timestream, and you can gain useful (if cryptic) hints from the stars' alignment. Once per night, if you can clearly see the stars, you can spend 1 hour reading the heavens to see how they relate to a particular goal, event, or activity that will occur within 1 week. The GM rolls a secret check, either a DC 28 {@skill Lore||Astrology Lore} check or a DC 32 {@skill Occultism} check. On a success, you learn a cryptic clue or piece of advice that could help with the chosen event, and on a critical failure, you learn a misleading cryptic clue or piece of advice.

feat.name: Heir of the Watchers
entries: Your ability to look into the past and future through the stars is near perfect. When you use Xelor Astrology, roll {@dice 1d4} instead; on a 1, you take a –1 penalty to the skill check. On any other result, you gain a circumstance bonus of that value (for instance, a +3 circumstance bonus on a 3).

feat.name: Wakfu Font
feat.prerequisite: focus pool, at least one innate spell from a xelor heritage or ancestry feat that shares a tradition with at least one of your focus spells
entries: The magic within you provides increased energy you can use to focus. You regain 1 Focus Point, up to your usual maximum.

feat.name: Xelor Weapon Exactness
entries: You know more xelor magic. During your daily preparations, choose {@spell anticipate peril|LOGM}, {@spell déjà vu|APG}, or {@spell fleet step}. You can cast this as a 1st-level divine innate spell once that day.

feat.name: Xelor Spell Mysteries
feat.prerequisite: at least one innate spell from a xelor heritage or ancestry feat
entries: You know more xelor magic. During your daily preparations, choose {@spell anticipate peril|LOGM}, {@spell déjà vu|APG}, or {@spell fleet step}. You can cast this as a 1st-level divine innate spell once that day.

feat.name: Universal Obsession
entries: Your desire for knowledge has led you from one pursuit to another and granted you a smattering of expertise with myriad crafts and professions. You reflect on snippets you've learned to temporarily become trained in one {@skill Lore} skill of your choice. This proficiency lasts for 10 minutes or until you critically fail a check with that skill. Since this training is temporary, you can't use it as a prerequisite for a permanent character option like a feat or a skill increase.

feat.name: Sinistro Familiar
entries: You have constructed a companion for yourself. You gain a familiar. The type of creature is up to you, but it's usually owl-themed even if it lacks flight.

feat.name: Guided by the Timestream
feat.trigger: You are about to attempt a skill check or saving throw.
entries: Xelor's Clock grants you insights that guide your actions. You roll twice and take the better result. If it's night and you can see the stars, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to the triggering roll.

feat.name: Xelor Weapon Familiarity
entries: A Xelor can use a variety of weapons with remarkable precision. You are trained with the {@item dart}, {@item warhammer}, {@item spear}, {@item staff}, and {@item bladed scarf|LOGM}. In addition, you gain access to bladed scarves you chose and all {@filter uncommon xelor weapons|items||Category=Weapon|Rarity=Uncommon|Ancestry & Heritage=xelor}. For the purpose of determining your proficiency, martial xelor weapons are simple weapons and advanced xelor weapons are martial weapons.

feat.name: Xelor's Sandglass Lore
entries: You have lived the life that Xelor intended, following all of his tenets. You gain the trained proficiency in your choice of {@skill Arcana} and either {@skill Crafting} or {@skill Occultism}. If you would automatically become trained in one of those skills (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You also become trained in {@skill Lore||Xelor Lore}.

feat.name: Xelor Obsession
entries: When a topic captures your attention, you study it to the very last detail. Pick a {@skill Lore} skill. You gain the trained proficiency rank in that skill. At 2nd level, you gain expert proficiency in the chosen {@skill Lore} as well as the {@skill Lore} granted by your background, if any. At 7th level you gain master proficiency in these {@skill Lore} skills, and at 15th level you gain legendary proficiency in them.

feat.name: Xelor Astrology
feat.requirements: You must spend 10 minutes just after your daily preparations examining the sky or consulting a star chart or you can't use this action that day.
entries: Through the stars you can consult what Xelor's Clock has in store for you. You recall the stars' predictions about your current situation. If your next action requires you to attempt one or more skill checks, roll {@dice 1d8}. On a result of 6, 7, or 8, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to the first such skill check you attempt. On a 3, 4, or 5, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus. On a 2, you gain nothing. On a 1, you take a –1 circumstance penalty to the skill check.

feat.name: Temporal Shield
entries: You make a shield from sandglass sand to deflect attacks. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn.

feat.name: Magic Affinity
entries: Your connection to the Xelor's Clock grants you a divine innate spell. Choose one {@filter cantrip|spells||tradition & Spell List=divine|level=0} from the divine spell list. You can cast this spell as a divine innate spell at will. A cantrip is heightened to a spell level equal to half your level rounded up.

feat.name: Consult the Timestream
entries: You find wisdom in the movements of the stars, connecting you to Xelor's Clock. Once per day, you can spend 10 minutes to draw upon your readings of a recent night's sky to gain the trained proficiency rank in one skill of your choice; the chosen skill's key attribute must be Charisma, Intelligence, or Wisdom. This proficiency lasts until your next daily preparation. Since this proficiency is temporary, you can't use it as a prerequisite for a skill increase or a permanent character option like a feat.

feat.name: Lethal Attack
entries: You channel all of Sram's viciousness into your next dagger attack. You cover a knife's blade with shadows. The first time this turn that you hit a creature with a {@action Strike} using a weapon in the {@group knife} group you've modified in this way, that creature takes an additional 60 damage (basic Fortitude save using your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher) as the knife works to end their life. This additional damage is of the same type as the initial attack dealt. If you hit more than one creature at the same time, choose one to suffer the effect of your attack.

feat.name: Behind the Curtain
entries: You use Sram's furtive magic to place a one-way invisibility wall. Once per day, you can cast {@spell Invisibility Curtain|SoM} as a 7th-level divine innate spell.

feat.name: Disappearing Act
feat.trigger: You successfully use {@skill Stealth} to {@action Hide} and become {@condition hidden} from all your current foes, or use {@skill Stealth} to {@action Sneak} and become {@condition undetected} to all your current foes.
entries: With a powerful talent for misdirection, you slip from your adversaries' notice so thoroughly you appear to be somewhere else. You become {@condition invisible} for 1 minute or until you take a hostile action, whichever comes first. Choose a location within 10 feet of you.
