Until your invisibility ends, you appear to be hidden in that location to anyone trying to find you. If the searcher gets clear evidence that you're not there, they no longer think you're {@condition hidden} there, but they don't discover your actual location.

feat.name: Sram Weapon Expertise
entries: Whenever you gain a class feature that grants you expert or greater proficiency in certain weapons, you also gain that proficiency rank in all weapons you are trained in from {@feat Sram Weapon Familiarity|FPKrosmoz}.

feat.name: Shadow Sneak
entries: You excel at going unnoticed, especially among a crowd. You no longer need to have cover or be {@condition concealed} to {@action Hide} or {@action Sneak}. If you would have lesser cover from creatures, you gain cover and can {@action Take Cover}, and if you would have cover from creatures, you gain greater cover.

feat.name: Shadow Warp
entries: Your connection to shadows grows, allowing you to use them as a means of transportation. You can spend 1 minute in focused preparation, then enter a shadow your size or larger to instantly teleport to any shadow that is your size or larger up to 2 mile away. You cannot teleport to an area of complete darkness or with light from all directions such that there isn't any shadow. Once you enter the shadow, you instantly know the rough locations of other large shadows within range and can exit from the original shadow, if you prefer. You can't carry extradimensional spaces with you when you teleport; if you attempt to do so, the activity fails.

feat.name: Lethal Trap
entries: You've learned how to create traps that cause greater injuries. You deal an additional {@damage 1d6} precision damage with damaging snares you craft. This increases to {@damage 2d6} additional precision damage if you're legendary in {@skill Crafting}.

feat.name: Greater Lurker
entries: You can move up to your Speed when you use the {@action Sneak} action, and you no longer need to have cover or greater cover or be {@condition concealed} to {@action Hide} or {@action Sneak}.

feat.name: Untraceable
entries: You leave little sign when attempting to remain unseen. When you {@action Avoid Notice}, you also gain the benefits of {@action Cover Tracks} unless you choose not to.

feat.name: Sram Magic
entries: You channel Sram's furtive magic. You can cast {@spell Invisibility} and {@spell Obscuring Mist} each once per day as 2nd-level divine innate spells.

feat.name: Shadow Double
entries: You sculpt an invisible double of yourself from your own shadow. You cast the {@spell Unseen Servant} spell, and both the spell and the servant gain the {@trait Shadow} trait. The servant also has your ability scores (other than Intelligence and Wisdom) and skill proficiencies, and can manipulate shadows to {@action Create a Diversion} using the {@skill Intimidate} skill. You also gain a special reaction.

entries.name: Switcheroo
entries.trigger: Your {@creature Unseen Servant|crb} is within 60 feet of you and you stop {@action sustain a spell||sustaining} it
entries: You switch places with your {@creature unseen servant|crb} the instant before it disappears.

feat.name: Perfected Night Sight
entries: You magically enhance your sight to improve your {@ability darkvision}. You gain {@ability greater darkvision} for 1 minute.

feat.name: Nasty Traps
feat.prerequisites: expert in {@skill Deception} or {@skill Intimidation}, {@feat Snare Crafting}
feat.trigger: A creature fails or critically fails a save against your snare.
entries: Your snares are so befuddling that your victims rarely notice you slipping out of sight. If you have expert proficiency in {@skill Deception}, you can {@action Create a Diversion} against the triggering creature. If you have expert proficiency in {@skill Intimidation}, you can instead {@action Demoralize} the triggering creature. If you have both, choose one of the two effects.

feat.name: Between the Ribs
entries: You know how to make a stab hurt worse. When you {@action Strike} a {@condition flat-footed} creature using a melee weapon or unarmed attack that has the {@trait agile} and {@trait finesse} traits, it gains the {@trait backstabber} trait.

feat.name: Trap Genius
entries: Your expertise makes your snares more powerful, and you can place them quickly and efficiently. Each day during your daily preparations, you can prepare three snares from your formula book for quick deployment; if the snare normally takes 1 minute to {@action Craft}, you can {@action Craft} it with 3 {@action Interact} actions. Snares prepared in this way don't cost you any resources to {@action Craft}. The number of snares you can prepare this way increases to four if you are a master in {@skill Crafting}, and to five if you are legendary.

When you {@action Craft} and deploy a snare that deals damage, any creature that critically fails its saving throw against the snare's initial effect and takes damage becomes {@condition flat-footed} until the end of its next turn.

feat.name: Sram Weapon Efficiency
entries: You can now make the most out of your weapons. Whenever you critically hit using one of the weapons from your {@feat Sram Weapon Familiarity|FPKrosmoz}, you apply the weapon's critical specialization effect.

feat.name: Manipulating Shadow
entries: You can perform simple {@action Interact} actions with your shadow, such as opening an unlocked door. Anything your shadow {@action Interact||Interacts} with must be within your reach. Your shadow can't perform actions that require significant manual dexterity, including any action that would require a check to accomplish, and you can't use it to hold items.

feat.name: Fear of the Dark
entries: You can magically instill fear into your enemy's heart. You can cast {@spell Fear} once per day as a divine innate spell.

feat.name: Dreadful Assault
entries: You take advantage of your opponent's fears. When you succeed at a melee weapon {@action Strike} against a {@condition frightened} foe, that foe can't reduce their {@condition frightened} condition below 1 until the beginning of your next turn. Additionally {@condition frightened} foes are {@condition flat-footed} to you.

feat.name: As a Shadow
entries: You have learned to remain hidden in other people's shadows to avoid drawing attention to yourself. You can use creatures that are at least your size (usually Medium or larger) as cover for the {@action Hide} and {@action Sneak} actions, though you still can't use such creatures as cover for other uses, such as the {@action Take Cover} action.

feat.name: Trap Setter
entries: A Sram's snare is unrivaled, as it's one of their favored method of assassination. You gain the trained proficiency in {@skill Crafting}. If you were already trained in {@skill Crafting}, you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You gain access to all {@filter uncommon sram snares|items||Category=snare|Rarity=Uncommon|Ancestry & Heritage=sram}. You gain the {@feat Snare Crafting} feat, though when choosing your formulas for that feat, you can also choose from {@filter uncommon sram snares|items||Category=snare|Rarity=Uncommon|Ancestry & Heritage=sram}, as well as common snares.

feat.name: Sram Weapon Familiarity
entries: A dagger through the ribs is a Sram's favored method of assassination, but there are many kinds of dagger. You are trained with the {@item dagger}, {@item main-gauche}, {@item scythe}, and one {@filter uncommon knife|rarity=uncommon|group=knife} of your choice. In addition, you gain access to the {@filter uncommon knife|rarity=uncommon|group=knife} you chose and all {@filter uncommon sram weapons|items||Category=Weapon|Rarity=Uncommon|Ancestry & Heritage=sram}. For the purpose of determining your proficiency, martial sram weapons are simple weapons and advanced sram weapons are martial weapons.

feat.name: Sram's Shadow Lore
entries: You have lived the life that Sram intended, following all of his tenets. You gain the trained proficiency in {@skill Stealth} and {@skill Thievery}. If you would automatically become trained in one of those skills (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You also become trained in {@skill Lore||Sram Lore}.

feat.name: Shadow Blending
feat.trigger: A creature attempts a flat check to target you while you're {@condition concealed} or {@condition hidden} due to dim light or darkness.
entries: You draw shadows close to create a shroud. Increase the DC of the flat check by 2 to saving throws against that effect until the start of your turn, and you gain the {@condition dazzled} condition for 1 round.

feat.name: Skull Regalia
entries: You are either a skeleton or wear plenty of skulls and bones, making people uncomfortable. You become trained in {@skill Intimidation} and gain the {@feat Intimidating Glare} skill feat. If you're already trained in {@skill Intimidation}, you instead become trained in a skill of your choice.

feat.name: Lurker
entries: Nobody hides as well as a Sram. You can move 5 feet farther when you take the {@action Sneak} action, up to your Speed. In addition, as long as you continue to use {@action Sneak} actions and succeed at your {@skill Stealth} check, you don't become {@condition observed} if you don't have cover or greater cover and aren't {@condition concealed} at the end of the {@action Sneak} action, as long as you have cover or greater cover or are {@condition concealed} at the end of your turn.

feat.name: Eyes of the Dark
entries: You've grown so used to the dark that your sight has completely adapted. You gain {@ability darkvision}.

feat.name: Regenerating Word
entries: You can call forth a holy word of power directly from the mouth of Eniripsa to cast powerful healing magic on your allies. You can cast {@spell regenerate} as a 7th-level divine innate spell once per day.

feat.name: Rallying Word
entries: Your words of power can give strength to your companions. All allies within 30 feet that can hear you gain a number of temporary Hit Points equal to your level. In addition, these allies become {@condition quickened} for 1 minute but can only use the extra action to {@action Step}, {@action Stride}, or {@action Strike}.

feat.name: Overwhelming Word
entries: You can call forth a holy word of power directly from the mouth of Eniripsa to bring doom to your enemies. Once per day, you can cast {@spell divine decree} as a 7th-level divine innate spell.

feat.name: Preventing Word
feat.trigger: An ally within 30 feet would be reduced to 0 HP but not immediately killed.
entries: You utter a word of power, calling your companion back from the brink of unconsciousness. Your ally isn't knocked out and remains at 1 Hit Point. Your ally's {@condition wounded} condition still increases by 1 as though they had been {@condition dying} and recovered.

feat.name: Life-Giving Word
entries: Eniripsa herself whispers to you the words you need to save your allies from certain death. You can cast {@spell breath of life} as a divine innate spell once per day.

feat.name: Eniripsa Weapon Expertise
entries: Whenever you gain a class feature that grants you expert or greater proficiency in certain weapons, you also gain that proficiency rank in all weapons you are trained in from {@feat Eniripsa Weapon Familiarity|FPKrosmoz}.

feat.name: Almighty Wings
entries: You gain the effects of {@feat Empowered Wings|FPKrosmoz} at all times, rather than just once per day for 10 minutes. This includes the status bonus to your Speed if you have {@feat Soft Hovering|FPKrosmoz}.

feat.name: Agonising Word
entries: You utter words that would make a shushu shiver. You can cast {@spell Cloudkill} as a divine innate spell once per day.

feat.name: Transcendent Phasing
entries: You have grown more comfortable with your sudden phasing. The flat check DC of your Phase Shift feat decreases to {@flatDC 11}, and you are no longer {@condition dazzled} if you succeed.

feat.name: Healing Words
entries: Eniripsa's merciful magic flows through you. You can cast {@spell Heal} and {@spell Restoration} each once per day as 2nd-level divine innate spells.

feat.name: Harmful Words
entries: The power of your words grows. You can cast {@spell Blistering Invective|APG} and {@spell Sound Burst} each once per day as 2nd-level divine innate spells.

feat.name: Empowered Wings
entries: You fill your wings with magical strength for 10 minutes. You gain a fly Speed equal to your land Speed while your wings are empowered. If you have {@feat Soft Hovering|FPKrosmoz}, you gain a +10-foot status bonus to your fly Speed with Empowered Wings. As normal, since your fly Speed is derived from your land Speed, this status bonus isn't cumulative with a status bonus to your land Speed, if you have one.

feat.name: Blessed Elixirs
entries: The elixirs you craft are now empowered with divine energy. You gain the {@feat Bless Tonic|LOGM} general feat. Additionally when a creature drinks one of your blessed alchemical items it gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls for 1 minute.

feat.name: Baneful Poisons
entries: The poisons you craft are now empowered with divine energy. You gain the {@feat Bless Toxin|LOGM} general feat. Additionally when a creature is afflicted with one of your blessed alchemical poisons it takes a –1 status penalty to attack rolls for 1 minute.

feat.name: Wounding Word
entries: Your words can bring harm to your enemies. You can cast {@spell Biting Words|SoM} once per day as a 1st-level divine innate spell.

feat.name: Wondrous Vials
entries: You become an unparalleled expert crafting poisons and elixirs. You gain the {@feat Specialty Crafting} feat with a specialty in Alchemy. Additionally, learn the formulas for two {@filter common or eniripsa uncommon alchemical items of 5th or lower level, which must be elixirs or poisons|items||rarity=common;uncommon|item=alchemical|level=[0;5]|category=poison;elixir}.

feat.name: Soothing Word
entries: You use divine magic to harm your allies. You can cast {@spell Soothe} once per day as a 1st-level divine innate spell.

feat.name: Soft Hovering
entries: You've trained your wings to support your weight, you can fly through the air in short bursts at half your land Speed. If you don't end your movement on solid ground, you fall at the end of your turn.

feat.name: Eniripsa Weapon Meticulousness
entries: You can now make the most out of your weapons. Whenever you critically hit using one of the weapons from your {@feat Eniripsa Weapon Familiarity|FPKrosmoz}, you apply the weapon's critical specialization effect.

feat.name: Enhanced Immune System
entries: You have tested plenty of poisons and elixirs with your own body, giving you an enhanced immune system. You have a +1 circumstance bonus to saves against poison and harmful effects from elixirs. If you roll a success on your saving throw against an elixir or poison, you get a critical success instead.

feat.name: Phase Shift
feat.trigger: You would take damage from an attack, spell, or other effect.
entries: When in danger you can suddenly phase out and become intangible for a second, but doing so greatly disorients you. Roll a DC {@flatDC 16} flat check. On a success, you gain resistance to all damage equal to your level against the triggering effect, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to saving throws against that effect until the start of your turn, and you gain the {@condition dazzled} condition for 1 round.

feat.name: Medical Steadiness
entries: You are deeply familiar with the death of others and other gruesome experiences. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against {@trait emotion} effects. If you roll a success on a saving throw against an {@trait emotion} effect, you get a critical success instead.

feat.name: Helpful Nature
entries: "Help me help you" is a famous Eniripsa idiom, if a friend needs help there's no-one better than you. You gain a +4 circumstance bonus on checks to {@action Aid}.

feat.name: Eniripsa Weapon Familiarity
entries: Many Eniripsas have learnt to defend themselves, breaking bones to heal them afterwards. You are trained with the {@item dagger}, {@item staff}, {@item main-gauche}, {@item rapier} and {@item khakkara|apg}. In addition, you gain access to {@item khakkara|apg|khakkaras} and all {@filter uncommon eniripsa weapons|items||Category=Weapon|Rarity=Uncommon|Ancestry & Heritage=eniripsa}. For the purpose of determining your proficiency, martial eniripsa weapons are simple weapons and advanced eniripsa weapons are martial weapons.

feat.name: Eniripsa's Hands Lore
entries: You have lived the life that Eniripsa intended, following all of her tenets. You gain the trained proficiency in your choice of {@skill Medicine} and either {@skill Acrobatics} or {@skill Crafting}. If you would automatically become trained in one of those skills (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You also become trained in {@skill Lore||Eniripsa Lore}.

feat.name: Elixir Knowledge
entries: You have always shown a great interest in alchemy. You gain the trained proficiency rank in {@skill Crafting}. If you would automatically become trained in {@skill Crafting} (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You gain the {@feat Alchemical Crafting} skill feat. You can add {@filter uncommon 1st-level eniripsa elixir|items||rarity=uncommon|level=[1;1]|ancestry & heritage=eniripsa|category=elixir} formulas to your formula book in addition to the options given by the feat.

feat.name: Coney Familiar
entries: You have a pet Coney that has become magically bonded to you.
You gain a {@filter familiar|companionsfamiliars||Type=Familiar}, and this familiar must be a rabbit. It still gets the benefits of familiar abilities, but its base form remains a rabbit.

feat.name: Divine Multiarms
entries: Six arms made of blood float at your sides as your blood vessels are blessed by Sacrier's tears. For 1 minute, you gain the following benefits:

items: 20 temporary Hit Points.
You are {@condition quickened} and can use the additional action to {@action Strike}.
Your unarmed attacks deal {@damage 2d8} damage and gain the {@trait Forceful} trait.
{@skill Athletics} modifier of +23, unless your own modifier is higher.

feat.name: Bloodthirsty Madness
entries: You lash out viciously even as you fend off death. Make a single melee {@action Strike}. If this {@action Strike} brings a foe to 0 Hit Points, this activation of {@feat Sacrier Ferocity|FPKrosmoz} doesn't count against its frequency.

feat.name: Sacrier Weapon Expertise
entries: Your training with Sacrier weapons has fully paid off. Whenever you gain a class feature that grants you expert or greater proficiency in a given weapon or weapons, you also gain that proficiency in the fist unarmed attack, {@item bastard sword}, {@item tekko-kagi} and all {@filter sacrier weapons|items||Category=Weapon|Ancestry & Heritage=Sacrier} in which you are trained.

feat.name: Unfalling Ravager
entries: The impulse to survive and continue fighting resonates deep within you. You gain a circumstance bonus to damage rolls on your melee {@action Strike||Strikes} equal to twice the sum of your {@condition wounded} and {@condition doomed} conditions (to a maximum of a +8 circumstance bonus to damage) whenever you have one or both conditions.

feat.name: Bloody Avenger
feat.trigger: You are adjacent to an ally with the {@condition dying} condition.
entries: No enemy will take down one of your allies, or at least not without paying the cost. Make a {@action Strike}. Roll twice on the attack roll and use the higher result.

feat.name: Blood Tentacles
entries: The tattooed blood in your body turns into tentacles. You can cast {@spell black tentacles} once per day as an innate divine spell, though when you do so, you spew them from your arms out to the appropriate range, where they take root and begin {@action Grapple||Grappling} creatures as usual. The tentacles recognize you as a part of them and don't attempt to {@action Grapple} you, even if you are in the area.

feat.name: Undying Berserker
entries: You resist the call of Externam with supernatural vigor. When you use {@feat Sacrier Ferocity|FPKrosmoz}, you gain temporary Hit Points equal to your level.

feat.name: Punishing Comeback
entries: The more damage you receive, the stronger you become. When you are taking {@condition persistent damage} or your {@condition wounded} value is 1 or greater, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Fortitude saving throws.

feat.name: Sacrier Magic
entries: You prioritize your allies' lives over your own and put your own body in the line. You can cast the spells {@spell Blood Vendetta} and {@spell Shield Other} once per day as 2nd-level divine innate spells.

feat.name: Goddess's Tattoos
entries: Your tattoos are a work of divine genius, a masterpiece of art, magic, and skin. Choose a 3rd-level divine spell from the same school as your {@feat Divine Tattoos|FPKrosmoz}, either a common spell or another to which you have access, including a lower-level spell heightened to 3rd level if you wish.
You can cast that spell once per day as an innate divine spell.

feat.name: Sacrier Weapon Fury
entries: You've learned to make the most advantage out of your fists and traditional weapons.

Whenever you critically hit using a fist, {@item bastard sword}, {@item tekko-kagi}, or a {@filter sacrier weapon|items||Ancestry & Heritage=sacrier|Category=Weapon}, you apply the weapon's critical specialization effect.

feat.name: Tattooed Weapon
entries: You bear tattoos enhanced by the mark of deity. When you select this feat, choose one of the options on the following page. When you critically hit using a weapon of the listed group, you apply the weapon's critical specialization effect. You gain a large tattoo.

items: {@b Axe:} {@group axe} or {@group pick}
{@b Shield:} {@group hammer} or {@group shield}
{@b Torch:} {@group bomb} or {@group knife}

feat.name: Reaching Tattoo
entries: Your tattoos empower your strikes and reach out towards your enemies. The damage die for your fist unarmed attack increases by one step until the end of your turn. In addition, the attack gains a {@trait reach} of 10 feet. This doesn't increase the reach of any unarmed attack that already has the {@trait reach} trait, but it does combine with abilities that increase your reach due to increased size, such as {@feat Giant's Stature}.

feat.name: Iron Guts
entries: Your stomach is particularly durable. When you succeed at a Fortitude save to reduce your {@condition sickened} value, you reduce it by 2 (or by 3 on a critical success).

feat.name: Empowered Tattoos
entries: You expand your tattoos to encompass greater magic. Choose a 1st‑level divine spell from the same school as your {@feat Divine Tattoos|FPKrosmoz}, either a common spell or another to which you have access. You can cast that spell once per day as an innate divine spell.

feat.name: Blood Pact
entries: You're exceptionally difficult to kill. The DC of your recovery checks is equal to 9 + your dying value, or 8 + your dying value if you have the {@feat Toughness} general feat.

In addition, whenever someone returns you to life using magic that would normally leave you debilitated for a week (such as {@spell raise dead} or the {@ritual resurrect} ritual), you don't suffer that condition.

feat.name: Bloody Blows
entries: Your lethal unarmed attacks leave bloody gouges or cause severe internal bleeding. When you critically hit with a {@action Strike} using an unarmed attack that isn't {@trait nonlethal}, the target takes {@damage 1d4} {@condition persistent damage||persistent bleed damage}. This can be because you're taking the penalty to use a fist for a lethal attack or because you have an unarmed attack without the nonlethal trait due to {@feat Bloodied Fists|FPKrosmoz}, or a similar ability.

feat.name: Way of the Tattoo
entries: You search to create your own tattoos and share this Sacrier tradition with everyone. You gain the trained proficiency in {@skill Crafting}. If you were already trained in {@skill Crafting}, you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You gain access to all {@filter uncommon sacrier tattoos|item||Rarity=Uncommon|Ancestry & Heritage=sacrier|Category=Tattoo}.
You gain the {@feat Tattoo Artist|SoM} feat, though when choosing your formulas for that feat, you can also choose from uncommon sacrier tattoos, as well as common tattoos.

feat.name: Sanguine Armor
entries: You reinforce the blood covering your body and become more resilient. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn.

feat.name: Sacrier Weapon Familiarity
entries: There is no weapon a Sacrier likes more than their fist, but some of them have learnt that often that isn't enough. You have the trained proficiency with the {@item bastard sword} and the {@item tekko-kagi|LOGM}.

In addition, you gain access to {@item tekko-kagi|LOGM|tekko-kagis} and all {@filter uncommon sacrier weapons|items||Category=Weapon|Rarity=Uncommon|Ancestry & Heritage=Sacrier}. For the purpose of determining your proficiency, martial sacrier weapons are simple weapons and advanced sacrier weapons are martial weapons.

feat.name: Sacrier's Blood Lore
entries: You know everything a Sacrier needs to know in life. You gain the trained proficiency in your choice of {@skill Crafting} and either {@skill Acrobatics} or {@skill Athletics}. If you would automatically become trained in one of those skills (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You also become trained in {@skill Lore||Sacrier Lore}.

feat.name: Sacrier Ferocity
feat.trigger: You would be reduced to 0 Hit Points but not immediately killed.
entries: Fierceness in battle runs through your blood, and you refuse to fall from your injuries. You avoid being knocked out and remain at 1 Hit Point, and your {@condition wounded} condition increases by 1.

feat.name: Penitence
feat.trigger: An ally within 30 feet gains the {@condition dying} condition.
entries: An ally falling down before you fills you with rage, gaining temporary Hit Points equal to your level for 1 minute. As long as you have these temporary Hit Points, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to attack and damage rolls.

feat.name: Divine Tattoos
entries: You have tattoos on your body blessed by the goddess Sacrier. Choose one of the following schools of magic: abjuration ({@spell shield}), conjuration ({@spell tanglefoot}), enchantment ({@spell daze}), evocation ({@spell divine lance}), illusion ({@spell bullhorn|SoM}), necromancy ({@spell chill touch}), or transmutation ({@spell sigil}). You can cast the associated cantrip (listed in parentheses) as an innate divine spell at will.

feat.name: Bloodied Fists
entries: Your fists have been forged by battle, your naturally tough skin and dense bone further hardened by conflict. Your fist unarmed attacks no longer have the {@trait nonlethal} trait and gain the {@trait grapple} weapon trait.

feat.name: Bloodied Fists
entries: Your fists have been forged by battle, your naturally tough skin and dense bone further hardened by conflict. Your fist unarmed attacks no longer have the {@trait nonlethal} trait and gain the {@trait grapple} weapon trait.

feat.name: Cra Weapon Precision
entries: You are adept at creating the Cra's beacon bomb specialty.

You gain the trained proficiency in {@skill Crafting}. If you were already trained in {@skill Crafting}, you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You gain access to all {@filter uncommon beacon bombs|items||Rarity=Uncommon|Category=Bomb|Item=Beacon}.

You gain the {@feat Alchemical Crafting} skill feat. You can add {@filter uncommon 1st-level beacon|items||Rarity=Uncommon|Category=Bomb|Item=Beacon|Level=[-1;1]} formulas to your formula book in addition to the options given by the feat.

feat.name: Beacon Aficionado
entries: You are adept at creating the Cra's beacon bomb specialty.

You gain the trained proficiency in {@skill Crafting}. If you were already trained in {@skill Crafting}, you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You gain access to all {@filter uncommon beacon bombs|items||Rarity=Uncommon|Category=Bomb|Item=Beacon}.

You gain the {@feat Alchemical Crafting} skill feat. You can add {@filter uncommon 1st-level beacon|items||Rarity=Uncommon|Category=Bomb|Item=Beacon|Level=[-1;1]} formulas to your formula book in addition to the options given by the feat.

feat.name: Beacon Expert
entries: Your expertise with beacons makes you able to prepare these mechanisms on a daily basis. During your daily preparations, you can create up to 3 versatile chassis that can be quickly turned into beacons. You gain the Quick Beacon action to turn one of those chassis into a beacon for which you know the formula. The number of beacons you can prepare this way increases to four if you are a master in {@skill Crafting}, and to five if you are legendary.

entries.name: Quick Beacon
entries.requirements: You know the formula for the beacon you're creating, you're holding or wearing {@item alchemist's tools}, and you have a free hand.
entries: You quickly prepare and activate your beacon, creating a single beacon of your level or lower without having to spend the normal monetary cost in alchemical reagents or needing to attempt a {@skill Crafting} check. This item has the {@trait infused} trait, but it remains potent only until the end of your next turn.

feat.name: Backline Fighter
entries: You avoid the attention of creatures focused on your allies. You can use lesser cover from your allies to {@action Hide}.

feat.name: Arrow to the Knee
entries: You attempt to hinder your enemy's movement by aiming at a precise location. Make a {@action Strike} with your ranged weapon within your first range increment.

On a hit, the target takes a –10-foot status penalty to its Speed or a –15-foot status penalty on a critical hit. This penalty applies only if the target has a land Speed and depends on legs or other targetable appendages to use its land Speed. As with all penalties to Speed, this can't reduce a creature's Speed below 5 feet.

feat.name: Reactive Sight
entries: You are always on the lookout for any danger. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to {@skill Perception} checks made as initiative rolls.

feat.name: Discernful Eyes
entries: Your keen eyes can see through anything. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus on {@skill Perception} checks against illusions and you ignore concealment caused by foliage.

feat.name: Elusive Scuttle
feat.trigger: An ally ends a move action adjacent to you.
entries: You take advantage of your ally's movement to adjust your position. You {@action Step}.

feat.name: See the Unseen
entries: You notice things that others can't see at all. While you're adjacent to an {@condition undetected} creature of your level or lower, it is instead only {@condition hidden} from you. You only need a successful DC {@flatDC 5} flat check to target a {@condition hidden} creature.

feat.name: Explosive Shot
feat.trigger: You {@action Strike} a beacon with a ranged weapon
entries: You can bring beacons to their maximum potential. Any creature that fails its saving throw against the snare's initial effect critically fails instead.

feat.name: Fulminating Shot
feat.trigger: You critically hit a foe with a {@action Strike} with a ranged weapon.
entries: Your arrow calls upon the divine intervention of your deity. You cast the {@spell Flame Strike} spell as a 7th-level divine innate spell centered on the target of the reaction.

feat.name: Absolute Acuteness
entries: When you focus your eyes carefully, your gaze can pierce through all obfuscations, even magical ones. When you use True Gaze, you gain the effects of a 6th-level {@spell true seeing} spell, using your {@skill Perception} modifier for the counteract check.

feat.name: Ruthless Beacons
entries: You've learned how to create beacons that cause greater injuries. You deal an additional {@damage 1d6} precision damage with damaging beacons you craft.
This increases to {@damage 2d6} additional precision damage if you're legendary in {@skill Crafting}.

feat.name: Cra Weapon Expertise
entries: Training has made you an expert with Cra weapons. Whenever you gain a class feature that grants you expert or greater proficiency in a given weapon or weapons, you also gain that proficiency for the weapons from your {@feat Cra Weapon Familiarity|FPKrosmoz}.

feat.name: Arcane Sight
feat.prerequisites: ability to cast the {@spell detect magic} cantrip
entries: You've trained yourself to constantly be on the lookout for magical effects, even when focusing on looking out for other things. When you are {@action Search||Searching}, you also gain the benefits of {@action Detect Magic} unless you choose not to.

feat.name: Terrain Advantage
entries: You can take advantage of the terrain to bypass foes' defenses. Creatures in {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} are {@condition flat‑footed} to you.

feat.name: Long Step
entries: You step further away from your enemies than anyone. You {@action Step} 5 feet twice.

feat.name: Cra Magic
entries: You channel the magic of Cra's Bow. You can cast {@spell acid arrow} and {@spell spirit sense} each once per day as 2nd-level divine innate spells.

feat.name: Arrow Beacon
entries: You shoot down a foe with a beacon as a gift. Make a {@action Strike} with a Ranged Attack, as part of the {@action Strike} you also Throw and {@action Activate an Item||Activate} a beacon centered on the target.

feat.name: Advanced Scuttle
entries: You can scuttle farther and faster when maneuvering alongside allies. When you use {@feat Elusive Scuttle|FPKrosmoz}, you can {@action Stride} up to half your Speed instead of {@action Step||Stepping}.

feat.name: Roly-Poly
entries: A Cra always keeps their distance, as much as your enemies will try to keep you close. When you roll a success at an {@action Escape} check, you can {@action Step} up to 5 feet.

feat.name: Locate Weak Points
entries: You can enhance your senses and mental state to know exactly where to strike. You can cast {@spell true strike} as a divine innate spell once per day.

feat.name: Divine Archery
entries: Cra guides you and grants you some of her magic. You can cast the {@spell guidance} and {@spell divine lance} as divine innate cantrips at will. A cantrip is heightened to a spell level equal to half your level rounded up.

feat.name: Cra Weapon Familiarity
entries: You favor bows of all kinds above all weapons. You are trained in all common weapons from the {@group bow} group.
In addition, you gain access to all {@filter uncommon cra weapons|items||Category=Weapon|Rarity=Uncommon|Ancestry & Heritage=Cra}.
For the purpose of determining your proficiency, martial cra weapons are simple weapons and advanced cra weapons are martial weapons.

feat.name: Cra's Range Lore
entries: You've been brought up to know everything a Cra should ever know. You gain the trained proficiency rank in {@skill Crafting} and {@skill Society}. If you would automatically become trained in one of those skills (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You also become trained in {@skill Lore||Cra Lore}.

feat.name: Iop's Heart Lore
entries: You have lived the life that Iop intended, following all of his tenets. You gain the trained proficiency rank in {@skill Athletics} and {@skill Intimidation}. If you would automatically become trained in one of those skills (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You also become trained in {@skill Lore||Iop Lore}.

feat.name: Iop Weapon Familiarity
entries: You favor swords above all weapons. You gain access to {@item Aldori Dueling Sword|LOWG|Aldori Dueling Swords}. Additionally, choose two weapons from the {@group sword} group. You can choose from among all {@filter common martial swords|items||rarity=common|group=sword|weapon/armor category=martial}, plus the {@item katana}, {@item temple sword}, and {@item wakizashi|apg}. For the purpose of determining your proficiency, that weapon is a simple weapon, and if the weapon isn't common, you gain access to it. If you are trained in all martial weapons, you add common advanced swords to the swords you can choose from.

You also gain access to all {@filter uncommon iop weapons|items||Category=Weapon|rarity=uncommon|ancestry & heritage=iop}. For the purpose of determining your proficiency, martial Iop weapons are simple weapons, and advanced Iop weapons are martial weapons.

feat.name: Irrepressible
entries: An Iop never backs down from a challenge, always putting their head in the wolf's mouth. When you roll a success on a save against an {@trait emotion} or {@trait fear} effect, you get a critical success instead.

feat.name: Overlooked Mastermind
entries: You are not as simple as your brethren appear to be. You like to use your head sometimes, and not just in a literal way, but other people don't need to know that. You are trained in {@skill Deception} (or another skill of your choice if you were already trained in {@skill Deception}), and you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to {@skill Deception} checks to {@action Lie} when specifically claiming ignorance and to {@skill Deception} DCs against {@action Sense Motive} checks to uncover such lies.

feat.name: Unburdened Iron
entries: Armour is an essential part of war, and so you have learnt to wear them like any lighter kind of clothing. Ignore the reduction to your Speed from any armor you wear.
In addition, any time you're taking a penalty to your Speed from some other reason (such as from the {@condition encumbered} condition or from a spell), deduct 5 feet from the penalty.

For example, the {@condition encumbered} condition normally gives a –10-foot penalty to Speed, but it gives you only a –5-foot penalty. If your Speed is taking multiple penalties, pick only one penalty to reduce.

feat.name: Unconventional Weaponry
entries: There is no weapon that an Iop cannot make use of. Choose an uncommon simple or martial weapon with a trait corresponding to an ancestry or that is common in another culture. You gain access to that weapon, and for the purpose of determining your proficiency, that weapon is a simple weapon.

If you are trained in all martial weapons, you can choose an uncommon advanced weapon with such a trait. You gain access to that weapon, and for the purpose of determining your proficiency, that weapon is a martial weapon.

feat.name: Cornered Fury
entries: When fighting against the odds, you never give up. If a foe of a larger size than you critically hits and damages you, that foe is {@condition flat-footed} to you for 1 round.

feat.name: Iop Weapon Fervour
entries: You've learned techniques for using blades and other iop weapons. Whenever you critically hit using one of the weapons from your {@feat Iop Weapon Familiarity|FPKrosmoz}, you apply the weapon's critical specialization effect.

feat.name: Defiance Unto Death
entries: Iops tend to be simple of mind but that does not make them necessarily more susceptible to mind magic. Some of them will fight against any kind of mental manipulation with everything they have. If you would start your turn {@condition confused}, {@condition controlled}, or {@condition fleeing} due to a failed Will save, you can attempt a Will save against the same DC; on a success, you become {@condition paralyzed} until your next turn, rather than act against your will.

feat.name: Martial Experience
entries: You've crossed blades with a wide variety of foes wielding a wide variety of weapons, and you've learned the basics of fighting with nearly any of them. When wielding a weapon you aren't proficient with, treat your level as your proficiency bonus.
At 11th level, you become trained in all weapons.

feat.name: Victorious Vigor
feat.trigger: You bring a foe to 0 Hit Points.
entries: Your victories in battle fill you with pride and imbue you with the energy to fight a bit longer despite your wounds.
You gain temporary Hit Points equal to your Constitution modifier until the end of your next turn.

feat.name: Battleforger
entries: You can sharpen weapons, polish armor, and apply special techniques to temporarily gain better effects from your armaments. By spending 1 hour working on a weapon or armor, you can grant it the effects of a +1 potency rune until your next daily preparations, gaining a +1 item bonus to attack rolls for a weapon or increasing armor's item bonus to AC by 1. This has no effect if the weapon or armor already had a potency rune.

feat.name: Glory And Valor!
entries: You are a follower of Iop, The Lord of the Brave. You call upon your god with a mighty cry that fills you with a revitalizing energy for 1 minute or until you critically fail a {@action Strike}, whichever comes first. For the duration, the first time each round you successfully {@action Strike} a creature of your level or higher, you regain Hit Points equal to half your level.

feat.name: Heroes' Call
entries: The songs of ancient heroes echo through your mind and quicken your pulse, especially in dire straits. You gain {@spell heroism} as a 3rd-level innate divine spell that you can cast once per day. If you {@action Cast a Spell||Cast the Spell} when you have half or fewer Hit Points, you also gain temporary Hit Points equal to twice your level.

feat.name: Iop Magic
entries: You channel the magic of Iop's Sword. You can cast {@spell Spiritual Weapon} and {@spell Instant Armor} each once per day as 2nd-level divine innate spells.

feat.name: Iop Sword Training
entries: An Iop needs to know to fend for themselves with whichever weapon they have at hand. You can change any of the swords designated in your {@feat Iop Weapon Familiarity|FPKrosmoz} to different swords that meet the same specifications. You have to practice with a sword during your daily preparations to designate it, and the designation only lasts until your next daily preparations. This changes only your proficiency; it doesn't change your access.

feat.name: Can't Fall Here
feat.trigger: An adjacent and willing ally would be reduced to 0 HP but not killed.
entries: You physically help an ally remain standing and encourage them to push through their pain against dire odds. Your ally doesn't fall {@condition unconscious} and remains at 1 Hit Point. The ally also gains a number of temporary Hit Points equal to your level that last for 1 minute. Fighting onward with such an injury isn't without consequence; your ally's {@condition wounded} condition increases by 1.

feat.name: Iop Sword Mastery
entries: All swords are just an extension of your soul. You change one of the swords designated in your {@feat Iop Weapon Familiarity|FPKrosmoz} to a new one that you're wielding, provided the sword meets the specifications of {@feat Iop Weapon Familiarity|FPKrosmoz}. You can {@action Interact} to draw a sword as part of this activity, designating the sword as part of drawing it; disrupting that {@action Interact} action prevents you from designating it as one of your swords. This designation lasts until your next daily preparations.

feat.name: Iop Weapon Expertise
entries: Training has made you an expert with Iop weapons. Whenever you gain a class feature that grants you expert or greater proficiency in a given weapon or weapons, you also gain that proficiency for the weapons from your {@feat Iop Weapon Familiarity|FPKrosmoz}.

feat.name: Unconventional Expertise
feat.prerequisites: {@feat Unconventional Weaponry|FPKrosmoz}, trained in the weapon you chose for {@feat Unconventional Weaponry|FPKrosmoz}
entries: You've continued to advance your powers using your unconventional weapon. Whenever you gain a class feature that grants you expert or greater proficiency in certain weapons, you also gain that proficiency in the weapon you chose for {@feat Unconventional Weaponry|FPKrosmoz}.

feat.name: Heroic Presence
entries: The blood of heroes courses through your veins, and you inspire your allies to dig deep and find a new level of resolve. You grant up to 10 willing creatures within 30 feet the effects of a 6th-level {@spell zealous conviction}, though the effect automatically ends on a target if you give that target a command they would normally find repugnant. This action has the {@trait auditory} trait or {@trait visual} trait, depending on how you inspire your allies.

feat.name: Reckless Abandon
entries: Despite a lifetime filled with questionable decisions, you've managed to survive, as though you have uncanny luck that lets you avoid the consequences of your own actions. For the remainder of your turn, if you roll a failure or critical failure on a saving throw against a harmful effect, you get a success instead. Further, enemies and hazards that would damage you this turn roll the minimum possible damage.

These benefits apply only to harmful effects incurred entirely during your turn in which you activate Reckless Abandon, such as running through a {@spell prismatic wall}. Persistent damage and conditions that were applied prior to your turn proceed normally, and as soon as your turn ends you are subject to the full consequences of any dangers still threatening you.

baseitem.name: Cra's Hand Crossbow
entries: Bows are such an important part of a Cras life that many of them wish to keep one at hand at all times. Its mechanism is comfortable even for the purpose of loading, which is as simple as placing the bolt into the crossbow's compartment. It deals {@damage 1d6} piercing damage.

baseitem.name: The Blade
entries: Originally created by the legendary Goultard, many Iops have attempted to recreate the chain and sword combination that the hero named "The Blade", and some of them have succeeded. It deals {@damage 1d6} slashing damage.

baseitem.name: Razielle Sword
entries: It is said that ancient Iops forged these swords with tears of the angel Raziel. Even with today's crafting methods, this sword can very effectively channel your deity's power. It deals {@damage 1d6} slashing damage.

baseitem.name: The Knight's Cross
entries: In ancient times Iops would constantly fight over who wielded the largest sword. This competition has persisted and become part of various Iop cultures, leading to some warriors leading into battle with oversized blades on their back. It deals {@damage 1d12} slashing damage.

baseitem.name: Scissor Sword
entries: This sword was forged with the purpose of cleanly severing an opponent's limbs. For this purpose the blade can sometimes split into two scissor-like blades. It deals {@damage 1d6} slashing damage.

baseitem.name: Andy War Sword
entries: Crafted with the millenia old technique of smashing a rock against the blade's edge, a perfect blade for assaulting your enemies. It deals {@damage 1d6} slashing damage.

baseitem.name: Battle Spade
entries: This spade has a very peculiar shape allowing the handler to use it like an axe in battle. It deals {@damage 1d8} slashing damage.

baseitem.name: Battle Shovel
entries: This shovel was crafted with both the purpose of digging the earth and hitting someone's head as hard as you can. It deals {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage.

baseitem.name: Battle Scalpel
entries: The scalpel is an instrument many doctors have at hand, and some Eniripsas have learnt to use it to dissect enemies in battle. It deals {@damage 1d4} slashing damage.

baseitem.name: Apostrukel Scalper
entries: The original craftsman behind this weapon had a very gruesome idea of how to dissect their enemies in battle. It deals {@damage 1d8} slashing damage.

baseitem.name: Hidden Blade
entries: This blade is attached to a glove, coming out from the wrist area, and can be {@condition concealed} thanks to a mechanism. It deals {@damage 1d4} slashing damage.
You hide the blade inside a secret compartment. The blade gains the "{@trait Concealable}" trait but cannot be used to {@action Strike} until you {@action Interact} to bring out the blade.

baseitem.name: Clock Hand Sword
entries: This sword is fashioned like a clock's hand, with a spade-like point, built to make the most out of the momentum. It deals {@damage 1d6} slashing damage.
You hide the blade inside a secret compartment. The blade gains the "{@trait Concealable}" trait but cannot be used to {@action Strike} until you {@action Interact} to bring out the blade.

baseitem.name: Spiked Hammer
entries: This hammer has enormous spikes on one or two sides of it. It deals {@damage 1d8} bludgeoning damage.

item.name: Mineral Shovel
entries: This {@runeItem battle shovel|FPKrosmoz|+1 weapon potency||striking||crushing|} was crafted from rare crackler minerals, granting it greater digging prowess.

entries.name: Activate
entries: You cast {@spell Expeditious Excavation|LOGM} at 2nd-level (DC 20) from the shovel.
This is a {@runeItem battle shovel|FPKrosmoz|+2 weapon potency||greater striking||crushing|}.

entries.name: Activate
entries: You cast {@spell Expeditious Excavation|LOGM} at 6th-level (DC 31) from the shovel.

item.name: Dealer's Ring
entries: This ring of pure gold is a merchant's favorite, as its magic greatly helps with taking care of the shop. You gain a +1 item bonus to {@skill Diplomacy} checks.

entries.name: Activate
entries: You cast the {@spell Approximate|SoM} cantrip.

entries.name: Activate
entries: You cast the {@spell Quick Sort|SoM} spell at 1st level.

item.name: Springing Boots
entries: Iops always rush to the fray, and these boots will let them do so faster than anyone, jumping into the middle of enemy territory.

entries.name: Activate
entries: The boots cast {@spell Jump} on you as a 1st level spell.

item.name: Sword of Wrath
entries: This blessed {@runeItem razielle sword|FPKrosmoz|+1 weapon potency||striking|} can call upon your deity's wrathful might to vanquish the enemies around you.

entries.name: Activate
entries: You cast a divine 4th-level {@spell Divine Wrath} spell, centered on you. The spell DC is 27. You are immune to the spell's effect, though your allies are not.
This is a {@runeItem razielle sword|FPKrosmoz|+2 weapon potency||greater striking|}. When activating the sword to cast {@spell Divine Wrath}, the spell is 6th level (DC 33).
This is a {@runeItem razielle sword|FPKrosmoz|+3 weapon potency||major striking|}. When activating the sword to cast {@spell Divine Wrath}, the spell is 8th level (DC 38).

item.name: Air Beacon
entries: When this beacon is hit, it explodes with a great gust of wind. Each Large or smaller creature within the bombs listed range around the beacon must succeed at a Fortitude saving throw with the listed DC or be pushed away from the beacon. The wind extinguishes small non-magical fires, disperses fog and mist, blows objects of light Bulk or less around, and pushes larger objects.

entries.Success: The creature is pushed the first listed amount of feet away from the beacon.
entries.Failure: The creature is pushed the second listed amount of feet away from the beacon.
entries.Critical Failure: As failure, but the creature is also knocked {@condition prone}.

entries: Creatures within 5 ft. are pushed 5 ft. / 10 ft. away from the beacon, and the DC is 17.
Creatures within 10 ft. are pushed 10 ft. / 25 ft. away from the beacon, and the DC is 20.
Creatures within 25 ft. are pushed 15 ft. / 40 ft. away from the beacon, and the DC is 28. Additionally, creatures cannot move against the wind until the start of the activators turn.
Creatures within 40 ft. are pushed 25 ft. / 60 ft. away from the beacon, and the DC is 36. Additionally, creatures cannot move against the wind until the start of the activators turn.

item.name: Earth Beacon
entries: When this beacon is hit, it violently shakes and warps the ground around it. The ground in the listed range becomes {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} for a listed amount of time.
The ground within 15 ft. of the beacon becomes {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} for 1 minute.
The ground within 20 ft. of the beacon becomes {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} for 10 minutes. Creatures in this area must succeed at a DC 20 Reflex Saving Throw or fall {@condition prone}.

The ground within 25 ft. of the beacon becomes {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} and Hazardous Terrain for 20 minutes. Creatures in this area must succeed at a DC 28 Reflex Saving Throw or fall {@condition prone}.
A creature that moves through the area takes 3 piercing damage for every square of that area it moves into.

The ground within 30 ft. of the beacon becomes {@quickref difficult terrain||3|terrain} and Hazardous Terrain for an hour. Creatures in this area must critically succeed at a DC 36 Reflex Saving Throw or fall {@condition prone}.
A creature that moves through the area takes 6 piercing damage for every square of that area it moves into.

item.name: Fire Beacon
entries: When this beacon is hit, it explodes into bright flames. A fire beacon deals the listed fire damage, and each creature within the bombs listed range around the beacon must succeed at a Reflex saving throw with the listed DC.

entries.Success: The creature takes half damage and is {@condition dazzled} for 1 round.
entries.Failure: The creature takes full damage and is {@condition dazzled} for 3 rounds.
entries.Critical Failure: The creature takes double damage and is {@condition dazzled} for 1 minute.

entries: The bomb deals {@damage 1d8} fire damage to creatures within 10 ft., and the DC is 17.
The bomb deals {@damage 2d8} fire damage to creatures within 15 ft., and the DC is 20. On critical failure a creature receives an extra {@damage 2d4} persistent fire damage.

The bomb deals {@damage 4d8} fire damage to creatures within 20 ft., and the DC is 28. On critical failure a creature receives an extra {@damage 3d4} persistent fire damage and is {@condition blinded} for 1 round.

The bomb deals {@damage 6d8} fire damage to creatures within 30 ft., and the DC is 36. On critical failure a creature receives an extra {@damage 4d4} persistent fire damage and is {@condition blinded} for 3 rounds.

item.name: Appearing
entries: When you load a ranged weapon, the required ammunition automatically appears in your hand or weapon. This ammunition can only be used to {@action Strike} with the weapon, after which it disappears.

item.name: Homing Ammunition
entries: When you activate and shoot homing ammunition, the ammunition travels to your target, even around corners. You ignore the target's {@condition concealed} condition and all cover.

The ammunition additionally ignores the target's {@condition hidden} condition and does not require sight to your target if you have seen them in the past minute. You still require a clear path for the arrow to reach its target.

item.name: Attracting Tattoo
entries: This tattoo can pull a foe or ally closer to you, as if casting the {@spell Gravitational Pull|SoM} spell.
You cast the {@spell Gravitational Pull|SoM} spell. The effects change depending on the number of actions you spend when you {@action Activate an Item||Activate this tattoo}.
You cast the {@spell Gravitational Pull|SoM} spell. The effects change depending on the number of actions you spend when you {@action Activate an Item||Activate this tattoo}. The DC is 21.
You cast the {@spell Gravitational Pull|SoM} spell. The effects change depending on the number of actions you spend when you {@action Activate an Item||Activate this tattoo}. The DC is 28.

item.name: Claw Tattoo
entries: The tattoo covers your arm and upon activation turns it into a claw.

You gain a claw unarmed attack that deals {@damage 1d4} slashing damage. Your claws are in the brawling group and have the {@trait agile}, {@trait finesse}, and {@trait unarmed} traits. They also still benefit from any effect that would affect your fist unarmed attacks.

item.name: Holding Tattoo
entries: Sacriers often like to store their goods inside their own body, although from an outside perspective it's often not a great sight. The Bulk held inside the tattoo doesn't change the Bulk of the holding tattoo itself. The amount of Bulk the tattoo's extradimensional space can hold depends on its type.

You can {@action Interact} with the holding tattoo to put items in or remove them just like a mundane sack. Though the tattoo can hold a great amount of material, an object still needs to be able to fit through the tattoo to be stored inside.

If the tattoo is overloaded or the bearer dies, it ruptures and is ruined, causing the items inside to be lost forever. A living creature placed inside the tattoo has enough air for 10 minutes before it begins to suffocate, and it can attempt to {@action Escape} against a DC of 13. An item inside the tattoo provides no benefits unless it's retrieved first. An item in the tattoo can't be detected by magic that detects only things on the same plane.
Capacity 25 Bulk.

entries.with: The tattoo's extradimensional space can hold 25 Bulk.

entries: Capacity 50 Bulk.

entries.with: The tattoo's extradimensional space can hold 50 Bulk.

entries: Capacity 100 Bulk.

entries.with: The tattoo's extradimensional space can hold 100 Bulk.

entries: Capacity 150 Bulk.

entries.with: The tattoo's extradimensional space can hold 150 Bulk.

entries.replace: The amount of Bulk the tattoo's extradimensional space can hold depends on its type\.

item.name: Taunting Tattoo
entries: This tattoo makes it harder for a foe to ignore you, attracting their attention and also their attacks. You target a foe, which must succeed at a Will saving throw with the listed DC or take a –1 status penalty to attack rolls against creatures other than you for 1 minute.

entries.Success: The target takes the penalty. The spell ends at the end of the target's next turn.

entries: You taunt a creature that you can see in a range of 60 ft. and the DC is 20.
You taunt a creature that you can see in a range of 120 ft. and the DC is 28.

item.name: Cog Ring
entries: This ring is shaped much like a cog with lower and softer teeth marks for comfortable use.

While its simplistic image leaves a lot to be desired, it enhances your curiosity about clockwork and things you probably shouldn't stick your fingers into. You can use an Interact action to pull a repair kit from the ring. This kit appears at your feet and folds back into the ring if it's further than 5 feet from you. It grants you a +1 item bonus to {@skill Crafting} checks to {@action Craft} and to {@action Repair} clockwork and similar mechanical devices.
You cast the {@spell Mending} spell at 1st level.
The item bonus granted by this cog ring is +2. When activating the ring to cast {@spell Mending}, the spell is 3rd level.

item.name: Hourstaff
entries: This magic metal staff has an hourglass on the top containing blessed time sand, giving the wielder great power over time. While wielding the staff, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to initiative rolls.
You expend a number of charges from the staff to cast a spell from its list.

item.craftReq: Supply one casting of all listed levels of all listed spells.

items: {@bold Cantrip} {@spell read the air|som}
{@bold 1st} {@spell Anticipate Peril|logm}
{@bold 2nd} {@spell Augury}
{@bold 3rd} {@spell Impending Doom|som}
{@bold 4th} {@spell summon animal}
{@bold Cantrip} {@spell read the air|som}
{@bold 1st} {@spell Anticipate Peril|logm}

{@bold 6th} {@spell Cast into Time|som}

{@bold 1st} {@spell Anticipate Peril|logm}

{@bold 4th} {@spell summon animal}
{@bold 7th} {@spell Retrocognition}
{@bold 8th} {@spell Moment of Renewal}
{@bold 9th} {@spell Foresight}

{@bold 4th} {@spell summon animal}
{@bold 5th} {@spell Inevitable Disaster|som}
{@bold 6th} {@spell Cast into Time|som}

item.name: Paradox Spear
entries: This {@runeItem spear||+2 weapon potency||striking|} can allow the wielder to travel with it when thrown.

When you activate the spear, instead of making your {@action Strike} against a foe, you throw it at any unoccupied square you can see within your weapon's range increment and succeed without making an attack roll. You pull yourself through the Astral Plane, teleporting along with any items you are holding into the square where you threw the spear. If this would carry along any other creature (even one in an extradimensional space), the activation fails.

item.name: Voracious Blade
entries: The blade of this vampiric {@runeItem rapier||+1 weapon potency|} has the appearance of a red glass vial with a tube connecting to the wielding arm.

entries.trigger: You critically hit on a Strike with the Voracious Blade
entries: You drain blood from the target. You gain temporary HP equal to half the damage the target takes (after applying resistances, weaknesses, and the like) and it becomes {@condition Drained 1}. The temporary HP lasts for 1 minute.

item.name: Ghostly Shift Elixir
entries: You temporarily become incorporeal like a ghost. You gain the {@trait Incorporeal} trait and a listed resistance to all damage (except force, {@item ghost touch}, or mental; double resistance against non-magical) for a listed amount of time.
You gain the {@trait Incorporeal} trait and resistance to all damage 1 (except force, {@item ghost touch}, or mental; double resistance against non-magical) for 3 rounds.

entries.with: You gain the {@trait Incorporeal} trait and resistance to all damage 1 (except force, {@item ghost touch}, or mental; double resistance against non-magical) for 3 rounds.

entries: You gain the {@trait Incorporeal} trait and resistance to all damage 3 (except force, {@item ghost touch}, or mental; double resistance against non-magical) for 10 minutes.

entries.with: You gain the {@trait Incorporeal} trait and resistance to all damage 3 (except force, {@item ghost touch}, or mental; double resistance against non-magical) for 10 minutes.

entries: You gain the {@trait Incorporeal} trait and resistance to all damage 5 (except force, {@item ghost touch}, or mental; double resistance against non-magical) for 1 hour.

entries.with: You gain the {@trait Incorporeal} trait and resistance to all damage 5 (except force, {@item ghost touch}, or mental; double resistance against non-magical) for 1 hour.

entries.replace: You gain the \{@trait Incorporeal\} trait and a listed resistance to all damage \(except force, \{@item ghost touch\}, or mental; double resistance against non-magical\) for a listed amount of time\.

item.name: Stimulating Elixir
entries: This drink feels you with energy to fight with more fervour than ever. For the next listed amount of time after drinking this elixir, you gain an item bonus to attack rolls.
You gain a +1 item bonus, and the duration is 3 minutes.

entries.with: You gain a +1 item bonus, and the duration is 3 minutes.

entries: You gain a +2 item bonus, and the duration is 1 minutes.

entries.with: You gain a +2 item bonus, and the duration is 1 minutes.

entries: You gain a +3 item bonus, and the duration is 5 minutes.

entries.with: You gain a +3 item bonus, and the duration is 5 minutes.

entries: You gain a +4 item bonus, and the duration is 30 minutes.

entries.with: You gain a +4 item bonus, and the duration is 30 minutes.

entries: You gain a +5 item bonus, and the duration is 1 hour.

entries.with: You gain a +5 item bonus, and the duration is 1 hour.

entries.replace: For the next listed amount of time after drinking this elixir, you gain an item bonus to attack rolls\.

item.name: Umbral Blade
entries: This {@runeItem hidden blade|FPKrosmoz|+2 weapon potency||striking|} possesses a great Sram blessing allowing you to steal magic from a foe.
You cast the {@spell Umbral Graft|SoM} spell at 4th level. If you must attempt a counteract check, you roll a {@skill Thievery} check instead.

item.name: Skull Decoration
entries: These decorations go on a Sram's skull face or skull mask and serve to instill fear in their opponent's mind. While wearing these decorations, they grant you a +1 item bonus to {@skill Intimidation}.

item.name: Insidious Trap Trap
entries: This trap attempts to inject poison into the target. You fill the trap with a poison that has the {@trait Injury} trait in your possession through an {@action Interact} action when you lay it. When a creature enters the snare's square, they must attempt a DC 18 basic Reflex saving throw or be injected with the poison.

item.name: Drift Trap
entries: This trap is extremely slippery, aiming to destabilize your adversaries. The square with this snare, as well one adjacent square (to form a 10-foot-by-5-foot area) become greasy surfaces. Creatures using an action to move onto the greasy surface must attempt either a basic Reflex save or an {@skill Acrobatics} check DC 17 to {@action Balance}. A creature that {@action Step||Steps} or {@action Crawl||Crawls} doesn't have to attempt a check or save.

item.name: Teleporting Trap
entries: This magical trap works together with a special unique rune attuned to it, and is useful both to send a foe away or for escaping a dire situation. When laying the trap the rune must have been previously placed somewhere in a 100 miles range from it, or else the trap will fail to activate. When a creature enters the snare's square, it must make a DC 35 Will save or be transported to the square where the rune is located.

deity.name: Iop
info: The name "Iop's heart" has misled a lot of people, because if you think a Iop has a heart, you're mistaken! For some people, the heart symbolises love, friendship and little girls running through sunny, flowery meadows, but not for Iop and his disciples... this vital organ only interests them when they can rip it out of their enemies chests, still beating! Another characteristic of the god Iop is that he despises the weak. It's kind of mean, but that's just the way he is, and he'll never change!

flavor: Iop rewards the bravest warriors and punishes the cowards who would flee the battlefield.

Minor Boon: Iop grants you a weapon whenever you need one. You can use an {@action Interact} action to draw a 0-level non-magical iron weapon, even if you have no weapons on your person. Such a weapon lasts only as long as you continue using it to attack, and it can't be sold, given away, melted for scrap iron, or the like.
Moderate Boon: Your blows become unstoppable, carrying the momentum of Iop's thrill for battle. Your {@item bastard sword} and other {@filter Iop weapon|items||Ancestry & Heritage=Iop|Category=Weapon} {@action Strike||Strikes} gain the {@trait forceful} trait.
Major Boon: Iop imbues your blade with great power. {@item Bastard swords} and other {@filter Iop weapons|items||Ancestry & Heritage=Iop|Category=Weapon} you wield gain the {@item axiomatic}, {@item holy} (or {@item unholy} if you are evil), and {@item major striking} runes while you hold them. These property runes count toward the number of runes you can have on your weapon, and if this would cause your weapon to exceed its limit, choose which ones to keep each day when you prepare. You gain a +2 status bonus to attack rolls with {@item bastard swords} and other {@filter Iop weapons|items||Ancestry & Heritage=Iop|Category=Weapon}.

Minor Curse: Your blade and armor have dulled like lead. Your weapons, armor, and shields have half their usual Hit Points and Break Threshold.
Moderate Curse: You've lost the glory of slaying a worthy opponent. All of your weapon and unarmed attacks decrease their damage dice by one step, and all your attacks are {@trait nonlethal}.
Major Curse: All blades reject your wicked heart. Any weapon you wield automatically becomes broken after you {@action Strike} with it. This curse can't break artifacts or similarly powerful weapons.

entries.name: The Great Battle Hero; The Lord of the Brave; The King of the Sword

items: {@b Areas of Concern} strength, valor, and war

entries: The name "Iop's heart" has misled a lot of people, because if you think a Iop has a heart, you're mistaken! For some people, the heart symbolises love, friendship and little girls running through sunny, flowery meadows, but not for Iop and his disciples... this vital organ only interests them when they can rip it out of their enemies chests, still beating! Another characteristic of the god Iop is that he despises the weak. It's kind of mean, but that's just the way he is, and he'll never change!

entries.name: The Great Huntress; The Lady of the Bolt; The Woodland Beauty; The Api Queen

items: {@b Areas of Concern} archery, self-perfection, watchfulness

entries: Her beauty is as fearsome as her arrows... apparently, only her disciples can look at her without falling head over heels in love! Her followers must develop a pure, unfailing devotion to her... which isn't as easy as it sounds when she's demonstrating how to handle bows as effectively as possible...

entries.name: The Protector; The Guardian of the Celestial Troops; The High Shepherdess; The Lady with the Shield

items: {@b Areas of Concern} community, protection, and shepherds

entries: Though her disciples sometimes catch her admiring herself in the reflection of her shield, they never make any comments. The goddess Feca is a bit of a flirt but is also quite touchy and temperamental. She is extremely distrustful towards Rushu, the sovereign demon. She always suspects that he's preparing a dirty trick, despite his innocent expression (I mean, what kind of demon has an innocent expression?).

entries.name: The Mother of All Pain; The Iron Maiden; The Scarlet Damsel; The Angel of Compassion

items: {@b Areas of Concern} pain, protection, and sacrifice

entries: One of the last to enter the Pantheon of gods, this beautiful, rebellious and opportunist goddess endures suffering with serenity. Paradoxically, though, she can't stand seeing human beings in agony. Most of the time, her fanciful shows of mercy towards the weak and the oppressed are closely followed by vengeful anger towards the strong and oppressive. Her intense beauty and her masterly fighting techniques make her a fervently venerated goddess. She sometimes appears on deserted battlefields to drop a tear of sympathy on the earth where blood and defeated soldiers lie.

entries.name: The Chief Conspirator; The Master of Beasts; The Celestial Tamer; The Worm Charmer

items: {@b Areas of Concern} animals, beast tamers, dragons

entries: Silent and solitary, Osamodas prefers the company of creatures to that of people, and he passes this liking for monsters onto his disciples. He can summon any creature in the Universe as he knows them all and speaks their languages. He used to be an aggressive god who got carried away easily, and he has quite an eventful past as a conqueror of universes. Legend says that his long coat is made from skins cut off his enemies. Even if you don't believe that, he's a scary guy with an imposing reputation!

entries.name: The Time Lord; The Guardian of the Divine Clock; The Lord of the Hours; The Great Timekeeper

items: {@b Areas of Concern} astrology, space, and time

entries: Xelor is the master of Time. He is responsible for the Divine Clock, which sets the rhythm for the World's time. His face remains covered, hidden under a large pointy hat, and his hammer is stamped with the seal of the infinite. He looks threatening, and it's a good thing, as the demons of the hours, who love to kill time by being mischievous, might have misbehaved even more otherwise! Just like his disciples, he wears wrappings, except that his crumble to dust as soon as he moves...

entries.name: The Lord of the Shadows; A Spy in the Ointment; The Great Sneak; The Invisible Danger

items: {@b Areas of Concern} shadows, skeletons, and thievery

entries: The god Sram is unshakeable. He never reveals his emotions and always speaks in the same monotone without ever losing his cool. It's a quality he actually passed onto his disciples just like he did with his physical appearance, but the latter tends to be a less desirable trait.

Don't be fooled by appearances when in the presence of the god Sram, because he can make you believe anything about him - as long as it serves his own interests. The fact that people think he's an absolute idiot from the cosmic sticks doesn't bother him at all. In fact, he is calculating, manipulative and merciless. Don't you forget it!

entries.name: The Divine Practitioner; The Mistress of the Mushroom; The Queen of the Cold Compress; The Miracle Fairy

items: {@b Areas of Concern} alchemy, healing, and words of magic

entries: Eniripsa is a witty divinity who is curious about anything and everything. Some people even believe she's a little too curious, claiming that she loves to meddle in other people's business... The other gods appreciate her ineffable kindness and extreme sensitivity, but be careful, as being "sensitive" isn't the same as being "faint-hearted". As a matter of fact, an Eniripsa can mend a freshly ripped open paunch without batting an eyelid.

entries.name: The Doll Master; Dances on Wind; The Father of the Tree People; The Leafy God

items: {@b Areas of Concern} plants, puppets, and rests

entries: People say that "there are two things you can't look at directly: the Sun and Sadida", and that that's why this god always wears a mask, so that gods and mortals alike can converse with him. Sadida is the plant god par excellence. All he wants to do is make things sprout, blossom and bloom. His disciples get their powers from plant life and learn to use them to the fullest. Sadida can be seen from time to time during spring nights when the moon is full, dancing on the ridges, followed by a string of buds and flowers...

entries.name: The Gamemaster; The Big Tease; The Ace of the Dice; The King of Fortune

items: {@b Areas of Concern} felines, fortune, and risk-taking

entries: Only confirmed gamblers can appear to the god Ecaflip. They are the only ones who will find mercy in the eyes of the god and who can receive his favors. As for the others, some clever kitties will be shown what their future holds, but you can bet that the god Ecaflip, always a bit mischievous, will send anyone he doesn't like to the beyond... but give them a chance to escape...

entries.name: The Lord of the Spoils; The Flamboyant Golden Dragon; The Miser; The Stone Whisperer

items: {@b Areas of Concern} merchants, treasure hunters, and wealth

entries: A huge, divine dragon, his body is a mixture of molten magma and melted gold, and he can change anything he wants into shiny gold. That's where his disciples' insatiable desire for gold and treasure comes from. Being an avid treasure hunter, he travels all over the vast Universe and its numerous worlds, looking for rare and precious substances. He understands the souls of Dragons well, since he's related to them.

entries.name: The Eternal Thirst; The Princess of Pints; The Bamboo Lady; The Big Foamy Bear

items: {@b Areas of Concern} alcohol, drunkards, and parties

entries: Very few people know this, but the goddess was here when the World was created! Back then, she was a lot less powerful and was part of the vast group of lesser gods. One day, pondering on how to go about making people adore her, she found the remains of a Blop that had died from a squirt of Sporm. The whole thing was almost liquid and a cloud of Crows were stumbling around it. To her great surprise, the black feathered creatures were all drunk, staggering and unable to fly. This was an epiphany, and her powers started to grow as she experimented in the art of fermentation. She tried it on everything: plants and creatures, organs and peels, they all became liquids with unique flavours, and anyone who drank them would find themselves in a trance, leaving the goddess free to wrap them around her little finger! Soon everyone around was drunk and convinced that the goddess Pandawa was fabulous! She became so famous that she took what she believed was rightfully hers: a place within the gods' pantheon!
